Sr. Jesús is a merchant who buys and sells llamas to generate household income. The loan he is requesting will be used to build a wall behind his home, which will improve his quality of life. This is his third loan and the socioeconomic analysis indicates he has a favorable rating, thereby making him eligible to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall behind his house to provide better security

loans.name: Mother And Child Group

texts.en:
Loranda W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Mother And Child'. Loranda is 44 years old, single and has six children who range from 28 to 14 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. For 5 years, she has been selling charcoal in Waterside Market, Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 15,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 75,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of charcoal.

Loranda describes herself as peaceful woman. Her dream is to grow her business and continue to educate her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, David is inset at lower right because he was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El señor Fernando es soltero; vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de tembladerani sur de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor Fernando trabaja en una empresa de seguros y reaseguros como mensajero de donde obtiene sus ingresos para el hogar.

El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de un muro de contención y construcción de una habitación mejorando así su calidad de vida. Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. Fernando is single. He lives at his parents’ house in the district of Tembladerani, which in the southern part of the city of La Paz. Sr. Fernando works for an insurance company as a messenger so that he can earn income for his household. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair a retaining wall and build a room so that he can improve his quality of life. This is his first loan and the socioeconomic analysis indicates he has a favorable rating, which allows him to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair a retaining wall & build a room

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan C.  is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, bread, and groundnut paste at the market and is requesting a loan to stock fresh fish to fry and sell.  Susan is 35 years old and is married to a husband who is a watchman. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant.

loans.use: Stock fresh fish to fry and sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 46-year-old married man and father of 2 children from Lebanon. He has owned a shoe and bag factory in his town since 1985. He produces women's shoes only. He always tries to produce the new trends and collections for his customers and he also works on request of his clients. 

He is well known in this field due to the long period of operation and his experience; he distributes his products to different shoe shops all over Lebanon. And he is thankful for his business income. Today, he is requesting to borrow US$ 1200 to perform maintenance needed for his machinery and to buy supplies. He wants to expand his business and earn more income because his children will soon enter the university and he needs to gain more profit to be able to pay the fees.

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: perform maintenance needed for his machinery and buy supplies

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es:
El señor Remberto es casado y vive con la esposa y sus hijos de 16, 15, 9 y 7 años en casa propia en la zona Gran Poder de esta ciudad de La Paz. El señor Remberto trabaja como asistente administrativo en una entidad publica de donde obtiene sus ingresos para el hogar.

El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de dos habitaciones, revoque (significa planchar la pared con estuco) y pintura,  mejorando así su calidad de vida. Es su primer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sr. C. is married and lives in his own house with his wife and children (ages 16, 15, 9, and 7) in the Gran Poder District of the city of La Paz. He works for a public entity as an administrative assistant in order to earn household income. The loan he is requesting will be used to repair two rooms, as well as plaster (apply stucco) and paint the walls, which will improve his quality of life. This is his first loan and the socioeconomic analysis indicates he has a favorable rating, which qualifies him to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair two rooms in his house; apply stucco and paint to the walls

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more water to sell

loans.name: Rodm

texts.en: Rodm M.  is currently in the business of selling charcoal out of her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Rodm is 57 years old and is widowed.   She has 8 children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send two of her children to school.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sainte Famille Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAINTE FAMILLE est créé 27 juin 2007. IL fait partie du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE de Thiès. Il est composé de 09 femmes toutes issues de la même Paroisse que porte le nom du Banc Villageois (SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE). Les femmes ont organisé leur groupe par voisinage et par confession. Elles participent activement aux différentes activités de leur Paroisse. 

Madame Jacqueline N. à gauche de la photo, levant la main droite est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 62 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 3 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de trois autres enfants. 

Elle fait de l’élevage de porc. Parallèlement elle vend du pain dans un kiosque installé devant chez elle.  
Avec son prêt elle va acheter des pourceaux qu’elle va élever et vendre soit sur pied soit en abattage. 

Son objectif est d’assurer le payement de la scolarité de ses enfants. Son objectif à long terme est de construire une maison pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
The SAINTE FAMILLE solidarity group was created on June 27, 2007. It is part of the “Banc Villageois” of the Catholic women of SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE of Thiès. It is made up of 9 women who all come from the same parish, after which the “Banc Villageois” is named (SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE). The women came together as neighbors and members of the same church. They actively take part in the different activities of their parish. Mrs. Jacqueline N. on the left hand side of the photo, raising her right hand, is the head of the group. She is 62 years old. She is a widow and the mother of 3 children. She also takes care of 3 other children. She raises pigs. At the same time she sells bread in a booth set-up in front of her home. With this loan she will purchase pigs that she will raise and sell either alive or slaughtered. Her objective is to cover her children's schooling costs. Her long-term goal is to build a house for her children.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and raise pigs

loans.name: Concern Members Group

texts.en:
Alucious S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Concern Members. Alucious is 27 years old, single and was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 10 years, he has been selling men's shirts on Broad Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 10,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 47,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of men shirts. He describes himself as a determined person. His dream is to improve his business and go back to school.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of men's shirts.

loans.name: Sainte Therese Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAINTE THÉRÈSE est créé 27 juin 2007. IL fait partie du Banc Villageois des femmes Catholiques de SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE de Thiès. Il est composé de 10 femmes toutes issues de la même Paroisse que porte le nom du Banc Villageois (SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE). Les femmes ont organisé leur groupe par voisinage et par confession. Elles participent activement aux différentes activités de leur Paroisse. 

Madame Rose F., debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est également tutrice de 3 autres enfants.
 
Elle fait un petit commerce. Elle vend au marché du poisson frais, des légumes, du poisson séché, de l’huile de palme et de la pâte d’arachide. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante en marchandises afin d’accroître ses bénéfices.

Elle a comme objectif de participer au payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et à la dépense quotidienne. Et à long terme elle voudrait construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
The SAINTE THÉRÈSE solidarity group was created on June 27, 2007. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of the catholic women of SAINT JEAN BAPTISTE, in Thiès. It consists of 10 women, all from the same parish, which bears the same name as the Banc Villageois (Saint Jean Baptiste). They organized their group by neighborhood and faith. They are actively involved in the various activities of the parish. Mrs. Rose F., standing at the right of the photo and raising her left hand, is the head of the group. She is 49 years old, married and a mother to six children. She is also the guardian of three other children. She runs a small business selling fresh fish, vegetables, dried fish, palm oil and peanut paste at the market. Her new loan will allow her to acquire enough stocks to increase her profits. Her goal is to help pay for her children’s tuition and for daily expenses. In the long term, she would like to build a house for her family.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fresh fish, vegetables, dried fish, palm oil and peanut paste

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 31-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is a mother of one young child. She has established a computer business to help provide various types of reports and computer programs for members of her community and for different companies. She is a relatively new business owner. She started her business in 2007. She is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new laptop and a router to better market her services and increase the liquidity of her business. And she’s certain that with the new laptop, she will be able to deliver her reports and services faster. 

Note: Based on the political and social challenges of Lebanon, personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e., blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, not indicating his/her name and location, etc.) Ameen s.a.l. appreciates Kiva lenders' understanding of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Lebanon's borrowers.

About Ameen:
Ameen s.a.l. has been a major player in the Lebanese Microfinance sector since 1999. Originally, a micro-credit program created by CHF International, Ameen evolved to become Ameen s.a.l. in 2003, a Lebanese services company. In 2007, Ameen s.a.l. registered with the Central Bank of Lebanon to become the first Lebanese financial institution specialized in Microfinance.

At Ameen s.a.l. we pledge to provide financial services to the largest number of micro and small entrepreneurs and to the working poor, to help them develop their businesses and improve their incomes.

Ameen has been able to use its interest-free loans from Kiva to offer lower-interest loans with faster disbursement for their micro-loan borrowers. Since its inception, Ameen has provided high-quality financial services to over 41,000 borrowers and disbursed over 81,000 loans totaling $115 million. To learn more about Ameen, please visit http://partners.kiva.org/partners/115

loans.use: To purchase a new laptop and a router

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more cartons of men's shirts, trousers, socks, t-shirts, handkerchiefs etc.

loans.name: Daniel Saningo

texts.en:
Daniel is a farmer who is 32 years old. He has been farming in Naivasha town for the last two years.  He plants maize to sell and at the same time rears animals to sell.

He was introduced to KADET micro finance by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He has no history with any other MFI.  He plans to use the cash to add more cows to his herd of cattle, which he will sell later at a profit.  

Daniel also is planning to open up a retail shop in the near future, which he will run when not busy on the farm.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Cette femme âgée de 36 ans, est mariée avec 5  enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréales et des ustensiles de cuisine. Pour diversifier ses revenus elle exerce aussi des activités saisonnières telles que la vente de cahiers et de fournitures scolaires.
C’est pour préparer la rentrée prochaine qu’elle sollicite ce crédit.
Elle exerce cette activité depuis 1996 et  maitrise  ses différents contours. 
Elle espère grâce à ce nouveau crédit accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire et mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
This 36-year old woman is married with five children. She is a retailer of cereals and kitchen utensils. In order to diversify her income she also has several seasonal activities such as selling exercise books and school stationery. She is a requesting a loan in order to prepare for the new school year. She has been carrying out her business since 1996 and is able to manage the varying aspects of it. Thanks to the new loan she is hoping to increase her profit margin and respond better to her family's needs.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of articles for school

loans.name: Lydia De Fatima

texts.es: Lydia De Fátima tiene 48años, su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos y calzado, por lo que tiene más de 3 años pues siempre está buscando la amera de mejorar sus ingresos para mantener a sus 2 hijos que están a su cargo. Cuenta con una buena clientela que siempre esta pidiéndole buenos productos ya que los ofrece ambulante y en su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de materia prima como perfumes, cremas, shampoo, tratamientos, polvos y lápiz labial. Sueña con seguir mejorando sus ingresos cada día.
texts.en:
Lydia De Fátima is 48 years old. She has been selling cosmetics and shoes for more than three years. Lydia is always looking for ways to improve her income so that she can support her two dependent children. She has a good customer base that is always requesting the fine products she offers.

Lydia sells her merchandise as a traveling vendor and from her home. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy products such as perfumes, crèmes, shampoos, treatments, powders, and lip pencils. Her dream is to continue improving her income each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase perfumes, crèmes, shampoos, treatments, powders, and lip pencils

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Agé de 39 ans, cet homme est célibataire et enseignant de profession. Pour diversifier ses sources de revenus, il voudrait implanter un moulin pour son exploitation.
Il s’agit d’un moulin déjà installé qu’il envisage acheter avec le crédit solliciter, destiné à moudre les céréales spécialement le maïs.
Il espère grâce à ce nouveau crédit accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
This 39-year old man is single and a teacher by profession. In order to diversify his income sources, he would like to open up and operate a mill. The mill in question is already in place and he is planning to buy it with the loan he has requested; it will be used to grind cereals, and in particular corn. Thanks to this new loan he is hoping to improve his profit margin.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a mill

loans.name: Rahamatou

texts.fr:
Agée de26 ans, cette jeune femme est très active. Elle a pour activité la vente de produits d’alimentation générale.
L’activité se déroule au marché local de NUKAFU où elle met à la disposition des habitants du quartier ses différents produits. 
Le crédit demandé est destiné à réapprovisionner sa boutique pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle.
Elle est mariée sans enfant.
texts.en:
This young lady who is 26 years old is very active. She has a business selling general food products and does this at the local market in Nukafu, where she makes her various products available to the inhabitants of the neighborhood. The loan she is requesting will be used to get fresh supplies for her shop, in order to satisfy her customers more readily. She is married but has no children.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of general food products

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, de 43 años, está casada con Percy de 30 años, con quien vive en casa de sus padres y a quienes cuida por su avanzada edad, ellos hasta hoy en día no pueden tener hijos. Nora, inició sus labores agrícolas desde hace 6 años, junto a su esposo, a quien le gusta sembrar arveja, gladiolo, papa y maíz sobre los terrenos de sus suegros. Paralelamente a este trabajo, también cría animales, sea: ovino, porcino y reses; que los venden cuando necesitan algo de dinero para cubrir algún percance. Lo que más le gusta a ella es sembrar papa, pues que solo consiste esparcir las semillas en los surcos y esperar que sean cubiertos por la persona que aran la tierra. Por otro lado le es dificultoso cosechar arveja y papa, porque es cansado y pesado, pues necesita estar agachada por mucho tiempo para sacar los productos ya maduros y eso le provoca dolor de cintura. Sin embargo manifiesta que vale la pena porque las ganancias que obtiene son rentables. Por tal motivo, planea instalar una florería en la ciudad de Huancayo, aprovechando que sus familiares le han cedido una casa en dicha ciudad. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y esta feliz de seguir trabajando con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, por ser organizados y solidarios. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa invertir en la compra de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono orgánico, para sembrarlos.
texts.en:
Nora is 43 years old and married to Percy, age 30. They live at her parents’ house so that she can take care of them since they are elderly. As of this date, they are not able to have children. She began farming with her husband six years ago. Nora enjoys planting peas, gladiolas, potatoes, and corn on land owned by her in-laws. In addition to this work, she also raises animals such as sheep, pigs, and cattle. She sells the animals whenever money is needed to cover an emergency. What she enjoys most is planting potatoes. These seedlings must be spread out in furrows and covered by the person who prepared the soil. On the other hand, she finds harvesting her potato and pea crops difficult because the work is tiring and the loads can get heavy. She spends a lot of time hunched over gathering the crops that have matured, thereby causing her back pain. Nonetheless, she says the effort is worth it since her crops generate profitable earnings. Nora plans to open a floral shop in the city of Huancayo since she has taken advantage of a house in that area that was given to her by her relatives.

This is her third loan with MFP. Nora is happy to continue working with the members of her Communal Bank since they are organized and work well with one another. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of seeds for planting peas and several sacks of organic fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds for planting peas & sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Strong Brothers #1. Group

texts.en:
Rufus T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Strong Brothers #1. Rufus is 34 years old, single and has two children who are between the ages of 3 and 13 years old.  He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. 

For 4 years, he has been selling bread and juice on Water Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8,500 Liberian Dollars portion of this 41,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of juice and bread. He describes himself as easy-going. His goal is to grow his business and educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of juice and bread.

loans.name: Emma Chantal

texts.fr:
Mariée et mère de 2 enfants, cette femme est agée de 40 ans. Elle a pour activité, l’achat et la vente de détail  d’objets de piété et de statuettes religieuses.
Il s’agit de crucifix et des statuettes représentant des personnalités bibliques. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et au Nigéria pour revendre sur un étal devant l’Eglise Catholique de Wuiti.
Le prêt actuellement sollicité sera consacré à l’achat de nouveaux stocks d’objets d’art pour la revente.
texts.en:
Married and mother to two children, this lady is 40 years old. She has a business buying and selling on a retail basis religious artifacts and statues, namely crucifixes and statuettes representing biblical characters. She gets her supplies in Lomé and in Nigeria and resells them on a stall in front of the Catholic church in Wuiti. The loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy new supplies of artifacts for resale.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of religious artifacts for resale

loans.name: Sope Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE NABY est créé le 20 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 13 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SALLA DERGUENE.

Madame Ndèye Gagnsiri S. assise à gauche de la photo et levant la main droite, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge.

Elle fait un de l’embouche ovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois.

Son prêt lui permettra d’acheter trois moutons et de les emboucher pendant 5 mois avant de les revendre dans les marchés de sa localité.

Son objectif est de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille tout en renforçant son niveau d’épargne.
texts.en:
The Sope Naby solidarity group was created on 20th December 2009. It is made up of 13 women who all come from the same neighborhood and are either friends or neighbors. The solidarity group is part of the Banc Villageois in Keur Salla Derguene. Mrs. Ndèye Gagnsiri S., seated on the left of the photo with her right hand raised, is in charge of the group. She is 43 years old, married and mother to six children, who are in her care. She has a sheep fattening activity, which she has been carrying out since joining the Banc Villageois. Her loan will allow her to buy three sheep and fatten them up for five months before reselling them in the markets in her town. Her goal is to contribute to improving her family's living conditions, while at the same time boosting her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase three sheep

loans.name: In God We Trust. Group

texts.en:
Ruth B., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "In God We Trust." Ruth is a 27-year-old married woman. She and her husband have three children, who range in age from 2 to 8 years old. She explains that she was not able to attend school when she was growing up due to financial reasons.

For 4 years, she has been selling ladies' undergarments on Mechlin Street, in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She is now seeking a loan (6,000 LRD of the total 30,000 LRD group loan) to buy more ladies' undergarments. She describes herself as hard-working woman, and she notes that her dream is to improve her business and to educate her children.

loans.use: To improve her business by purchasing additional clothes

loans.name: Hohoè

texts.fr:
Cette dame a 41 ans, est mariée avec 3 enfants. Pour participer aux charges de sa famille elle fait le commerce de pagnes et d’oignons.
Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé auprès des grossistes. Elle revend ensuite ses articles sur un étal à son domicile sis  à Lomé.
Le crédit demandé servira à l’achat de nouveaux stocks de pagnes de haute qualité et d’oignons pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en:
This lady is 41 and married with three children. In order to be able to help with the expenses of her family, she sells lengths of African print cloth ("pagnes") and onions. She buys her supplies at the big market in Lomé from wholesalers. Then she sells her items at a stand located at her home in Lomé. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a new inventory of high quality "pagnes" and onions so that she can attract more customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of lengths of African print cloth and onions for resale

loans.name: And Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité AND LIGUEYE est créé le 20 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 08 femmes qui sont issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SALLA DERGUENE.

Madame DEGUENE D., debout à droite de la photo, emmitouflée de voile blanc et levant la doit, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 63 ans. Elle est mariée et mère 04 enfants.

Elle fait un petit commerce. Elle est détentrice d’une boutique où elle vend divers produits, tels du riz, de l’huile végétale, du sucre et d’autres denrées alimentaires. 

Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer sa boutique en marchandises afin d’accroitre ses profits

Elle participe à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Et chaque mois elle verse une épargne dans son compte dans le Banc Villageois.
texts.en:
The solidarity group AND LIGUEYE was created on December 20, 2009. It is composed of 8 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They set up their group based on similar interests and neighborhood. This solidarity group is a part of the "Banc Villageois" of KEUR SALLA DERGUENE. Mrs. DEGUENE D., standing on the right in the photo, wrapped in a white veil and raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 63, married, and the mother of four children. She is engaged in petty trading. She has a shop where she sells various products such as rice, vegetable oil, sugar, and other foodstuffs. Her loan will permit her to reinforce her inventory so that she can grow her profit. She helps to improve the living conditions of her family, and every month she will make a deposit to her savings in her account in the "Banc Villageois".

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: add to her shop inventory

loans.name: Strong Brothers #2. Group

texts.en:
Alexander K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Strong Brothers #2." Alexander is a 20-year-old, single man who was only able to attend school through the 11th grade due to financial issues.

For 5 years, he has been selling milk and sugar on Water Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his portion (6,000 LRD) of the group loan (30,000 LRD, or $425) being sought to buy more cartons of milk and sugar. He describes himself as a respectful person, and he notes that his goal is to improve his business and to go back to school.

loans.use: To improve his business by purchasing additional cartons of milk and sugar

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: Roberto, de 42 años es un hombre laborioso, que está separado desde hace10 años, tiene dos hijos, a quienes ve los fines de semana, vive solo en su casa propia. Hace más de 6 años trabaja de operario en chacras ajenas, ganando por día S/. 20.00 soles, al ver que era rentable la comercialización de productos naturales, decidió emprender este negocio,  es así que luego de 4 años, decidido cultivar plátano en terrenos arrendados, y a las que cuida con esmero y dedicación, puesto que le generan los ingresos económicos que le permite obtener mayores oportunidades y bienes, que mejoraran su calidad de vida. Lo que más le gusta es retirar la malezas de sus chacras, de esa manera le facilita el crecimiento de sus plantas. En adelante, quiere comprar terrenos con los ahorros que tiene para que pueda sembrar frutos que naturalmente crecen en la zona selva en la que se encuentra, asimismo desea instalar una tienda de comestibles en su casa. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y esta satisfecho de trabajar con su grupo comunal, donde las personas son muy colaboradores en cada actividad que desarrolla cada socio. Piensa invertir el dinero del crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcir sobre sus plantaciones para nivelar su producción, además comprará plantas de plátano para sembrarlos.
texts.en:
Roberto is 42 years old and an industrious gentleman who has been separated from his spouse for ten years. He lives alone in his own home and has two children who visit him on the weekends. For more than six years Roberto has worked as a laborer on other farms, earning 20 PEN each day. When he found out that selling natural products could be profitable, he decided to start a business. He now has been growing bananas on rented land for four years and looks after his crops with great care and dedication. This has helped him generate income for pursuing more opportunities and acquiring assets, thereby improving his quality of life. What he enjoys most is removing weeds from his fields because it helps facilitate the growth of his plants. In the future, he wants to use his savings to buy land for growing fruits that are normally found in the jungle. Robert also wants to open a grocery store in his home.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Roberto is pleased to be working with his Communal Bank group because the people have been very supportive of developing the individual business activities of each member. He plans to invest the money from the loan in the purchase of several sacks of organic fertilizer to help even out production. In addition, he will buy banana seedlings to plant.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase organic fertilizers & banana seedlings

loans.name: Bakh Yaye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BAAX YAYE est créé le 20 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 07 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SALLA DERGUENE.

Madame Magatte D., à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge.

Elle fait un petit commerce de légumes. Elle est aussi détentrice de kiosque où elle vend du pain.

Son crédit lui permettra d’augmenter son niveau d’approvisionnement en légumes afin d’accroitre ses bénéfices. 

Elle a comme objectif de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et de renforcer son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group BAAX YAYE was created on December 20, 2009. It is composed of seven members who all come from the same district.They set up their group based on common interests and neighborhood. The solidarity group is part of the "Banc Villageois" of KEUR SALLA DERGUENE. Mrs. Magatte D., on the right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 32, married and raising four children. She has a little business selling vegetables and she also has a kiosk where she sells bread. Her loan will allow her to add to her stock of vegetables so that she can expand her profit. Her goal is to help improve living conditions for her family and to add to her savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing more vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mana Chrity

texts.fr:
Agée de 40 ans, cette dame reste très active. Elle est revendeuse de charbons de bois. Elle voyage régulièrement à l'intérieur du pays pour s'approvisionner, notamment SOTOUBOUA, BLITTA. Elle y achète des sacs de charbons de bois. Elle associe à ce commerce, la vente de céréales et de miel.
elle vend ses marchandises à la devanture de son domicile. Le crédit actuellement sollicité est destiné à l'achat de 15 sacs de charbons de bois, 5 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs de mil et 2 bidons de miel.
Elle compte sur l’accroissement de ses activités grâce à ce nouveau crédit pour mieux contribuer aux charges familiales.
texts.en:
This lady, aged 40, is very active. She sells charcoal. She travels regularly to the back-country to stock up, notably to SOTOUBOUA and BLITTA. There, she buys sacks of charcoal. She also sells cereals and honey. She sells her goods in front of her domicile. This loan will allow her to buy 15 sacks of charcoal, 3 sacks of millet, and 2 jerrycans of honey. She is counting on growing her businesses thanks to this new loan so that she can better contribute to family expenses.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of charcoal, millet, and honey

loans.name: Enterprise. Group

texts.en:
Thomas S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called "Enterprise." Thomas is a 56-year-old married man. He and his wife have four children, who are between the ages of 9 and 29 years old. He explains that he was only able to attend school through the 11th grade due to financial problems.

For 22 years, he has been operating a carpenter shop on Broad Street in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his portion (6,000 LRD) of the group loan (30,000 LRD, or $425) being sought to buy more timber and planks. He describes himself as a determined person, and he notes that his goal is to improve his business and to continue to educate his children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Jebeh S. is in the inset at the lower right because she was absent when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: To improve his business by purchasing additional raw materials (timber and planks)

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU est Né le 20 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 08 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles ont formé leur groupe par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe de solidarité fait partie du Banc Villageois de KEUR SALLA DERGUENE.

Madame Astou N., debout à droite de la photo, levant le doit, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.

Elle développe un petit commerce de légumes et d’arachides. Elle fait également un  élevage de moutons.

Son prêt lui permettra d’acheter une brebis, des légumes et des arachides. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille tout en renforçant son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group SOPE SERIGNE FALLOU came into being on December 20, 2009. It is made up of eight women who come from the same district. They set up their group based on neighborhood and common interests. The solidarity group is part of the "Banc Villageois" of KEUR SALLA DERGUENE. Mrs. Astou N., standing on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 44, married, and the mother of three children. She is working at expanding a little business selling vegetables and peanuts. She also raises sheep. Her loan will allow her to buy an ewe, some vegetables and some peanuts. Her goal is to help her husband support their family while adding to her savings as well.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying more vegetables, peanuts, and also an ewe (female sheep)

loans.name: Balabawi

texts.fr:
Cette femme est mariée et mère de 7 enfants. Elle a 47 ans. Pour contribuer aux charges de sa famille nombreuse, elle commercialise  des produits d’alimentation générale et des céréales.
L’activité se déroule dans sa maison où elle met à la disposition des habitants du quartier ses différents produits. 
Le crédit demandé est destiné à réapprovisionner sa boutique pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle avec 5 sacs de riz GINO, 3 bidons d'huile NIOTO, 2 cartons de boîtes de conserve de tomates, 3 cartons de détergents et divers autres produits.
texts.en:
This lady is married and the mother of seven children. She is 47. In order to be able to help support her numerous family, she sells foodstuffs and cereals. She sells these goods in front of her house where she displays her wares to the people of her neighborhood. The requested loan is destined to allow her to add to the inventory of her shop, so as to satisfy the needs of her clientele, by buying 5 sacks of Gino rice, three tins of Nioto oil, two cases of tins of tomatoes, three cases of detergent, and various other products.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items for her inventory

loans.name: Teodosia

texts.es: Teodosia, de 42 años, vive en su casa propia, junto a su pareja Medardo, de 40 años y con uno de sus hijos, de los dos que tiene, porque el mayor trabaja de manera independiente. Ella, se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja, maíz, habas y gladiolo desde hace 20 años,  en terrenos que posee y del que cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo, quien le gusta surca la tierra. En  días libres trabaja como operario, ganando S/. 20.00 soles por día, con ello puede cubrir los gastos domésticos y la educación de sus hijos; paralelamente a este trabajo, cría asnos, toros y carneros que pastea en los campos. Lo que más le gusta a Teodosia, es sembrar los productos oriundos que crecen en su zona, además lo que no logra vender, es utilizado para su consumo, asimismo refiere que disfruta deslizar las semillas por sus manos hacia la tierra, sin embargo el tener que cosechar y trasladar sus frutos al mercado de su ciudad, le resulta pesado. En adelante, desea sembrar en mayor cantidad de gladiolos. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y refiere que desde entonces tiene progreso económico, por eso continuará pagando responsablemente sus cuotas para acceder a más créditos junto a su banco comunal. Con el crédito que recibirá,  comprará 2 bolsas de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Teodosia is 42 years old and lives in her own home with her partner Medardo, age 40, and one of her two children. Her oldest child works independently. She has been growing potatoes, peas, corn, beans, and gladiolas for 20 years on land that she owns. Teodosia has the help of her husband who enjoys plowing the soil on his days off from his job has a laborer. He earns 20 PEN each day, which is enough to cover the household expenses and their children’s education. In addition to farming, Teodosia raises donkeys, bulls, and sheep that graze in the fields. What she enjoys most is growing products that are native to her area. Whatever she does not sell is used for personal consumption. She also mentions she likes the feeling when the seeds pass from her hands into the ground, which will lead to heavy loads of harvested crops that she will able to sell at the market in her city. In the future, she hopes to plant more gladiolas.

This is her fourth loan from MFP. Teodosia says since joining the organization she has made economic progress, so she continues to submit her payments responsibly in order to be eligible for more loans with her Communal Bank. The loan she will receive will be used to buy two bags of pea seeds and several sacks of organic fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of organic fertilizer & seeds for planting peas

loans.name: Kozi

texts.fr:
Cette femme est agée de 32 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants.  Comme activité génératrice de revenus, elle vend des ustensiles de cuisine en plastique et divers.
L’activité se déroule dans sa maison où elle met à la disposition des riverains,  ses différents produits. 
Le crédit demandé est destiné à se réapprovisionner  pour mieux satisfaire la clientèle.
texts.en:
This lady, aged 32, is married and the mother of three children. In order to make a living, she sells plastic kitchen utensils and various other items. She sells out of her home where she displays her inventory for adjacent people. The requested loan is intended to cover replenishment of her stock so that she can better satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of plastic kitchen utensils

loans.name: Buen Samaritano Group

texts.es: Martha Haydee y Octasis Filomena conforman el grupo solidario Buen Samaritano. Por lo que juntas han logrado salir adelante, Martha se dedica a una pulpería hace mas de 26 años, anteriormente sus padres eran los responsables con este negocio, pero con el paso del tiempo Martha fue aprendiéndolo y tomándole cariño, actualmente es ella quien se hace cargo pues también con su experiencias y la variedad de clientes son la clave para seguir con su negocio. Octasis se dedica a la venta artesanía hace mas de 17 años que trabaja con esta actividad, por lo que le ha gustado y no ha sido fácil en la actualidad ella se ha unido con Martha para realizar un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima que ambos negocios necesitan.
texts.en:
Martha Haydee and Octasis Filomena make up the group “Buen Samaritano” (Good Samaritan). By working together, they have been able to get ahead. Martha has been operating a grocery store for more than 26 years. Her parents were previously in charge of this business but eventually passed it on to Martha after she learned how to manage it. Now that she is in control of the business, her experience and the variety of customers have been key components that have helped her continue forward.

Octasis has been selling handicrafts for more than 17 years. Even though she enjoys her work, it is not an easy job. She has currently teamed up with Martha so that they can both access a loan which will be used to buy materials they need for both of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Takku Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIGUEYE est né le 20 décembre 2010. Il est composé de 14 femmes issues du même quartier. Les membres ont monté leur groupe par affinité et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageoise de KOUNOUNE AIR FRANCE

Madame Aïda MABYE à l’extrême droite de la photo, vêtue de thioup mauve/blanc est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant en charge. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de bijoux et de tissus depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d’approvisionnement pour élargir son petit commerce.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne et participer au payement de la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en:
The solidarity group TAKKU LIGUEYE came into being December 20, 2010. It is composed of 14 women who all come from the same district. The members set up their group based on affinity and sharing a neighborhood. The group is a part of the "Banc Villageois" of KOUNOUNE AIR FRANCE. Mrs. Aïda M., on the far right in the photo, dressed in a mauve and white "thioup" (local, hand-dyed cloth,) is the leader of the group. She is 39, married, and raising an only child. She has had a small business selling costume jewelry and lengths of cloth since she joined the "Banc Villageois". With her new loan she is going to replenish her stock so as to expand her little business. Her goal is to help her husband with supporting the family and with the school fees for her child.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of costume jewelry and lengths of cloth for resale

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, de 31 años, es soltero, convive con sus padres, Alejo de 65 y Lucila de 64 años, juntos  viven en una acogedora casa que es propia, ubicado en la sierra peruana llamada “Patay”. Él, no quiere dejar a sus padres, tampoco las tierras que lo vieron nacer. Es por eso que las enseñanzas que le dieron sus padres, sobre las técnicas agrícolas, le han ayudado en su actividad agrícola. Lleva ya 5 años sembrando arveja y flores como el gladiolo, y considera que le es rentable, pues le permite terminar de estudiar una carrera profesional, como técnico de enfermería, además puede cubrir los gastos de su familia. Disfruta mucho la actividad que realiza, además para agilizar su labor agrícola contrata operarios, ya que no cuenta con la ayuda de ningún familiar. Dentro de sus planes futuros, planea continuar sembrando en mayor cantidad, además de instalar una tienda de venta de comestibles en su casa. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP,  y está feliz de trabajar con las personas de su banco comunal, a quienes aprecia, por eso trabaja de manera activa. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una bolsa de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 31 years old, single, and lives with his parents, Alejo (65) and Lucila (64). They live in a cosy house that they own, located in the Peruvian mountain range called “Patay”. He does not want to leave his parents, nor the land where he was born. This is why the teachings given by his parents about farming, have helped him in his farming business. He has been sowing peas and flowers such as gladiolus for 5 years now, and he considers it to be profitable, as it is allowing him to finish studying for a professional career, as a nurse, and he can also cover the family's expenses. He enjoys the business that he is in, and to speed up his farming work he contracts workers, as he does not have any family help. Among his future plans, he plans to keep growing in a bigger quantity, as well as setting up a store selling foodstuffs in his home. This is his fourth loan with MFP, and he is happy to work with the people in his communal bank, who his is fond of, that is why he works actively in it. With the loan that he is asking for, he will buy a bag of pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pea seeds.

loans.name: Saff Loxo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SAFF LOKHO est né le 20 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 14 femmes issues du même village. Les membres ont décidé de se regrouper au sein du même groupe parce qu’elles habitent le même quartier et ont des affinités. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageoise de KOUNOUNE AIR FRANCE

Madame Ndèye Penda K. tout à fait debout à droite de la photo, levant la main gauche, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de céréales locales (mil et maïs), de niébé et de la pâte d’arachide et des condiments pour cuisine. 

Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter un sac de mil, un sac de maïs, 20 kilogrammes de pâte d’arachide et des condiments pour cuisine. 

Elle a comme objectif de participer à la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne de la famille et d’assurer l’habillement de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Saff Lokho was created on December 20, 2009. It is composed of 14 women living in the same village. They have decided to create a group togehterbecause they are friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Kounoune Air France. Mrs. Ndèye Penda K., standing to the far right in the photo raising her left hand, is the group’s leader. She is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of five dependent children. Her business is selling local cereals (millet and corn) , “niébé” [a type of black-eyed peas], peanut paste and food condiments. With her new loan she would like to purchase a bag of millet, a bag of corn, 20 kg [44 lbs] of peanut paste and some food condiments. Her goal is to contribute to the family budget and to provide for her children’s clothing.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing local cerals, black-eyed peas and peanut paste

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To improve his business by purchasing additional cartons of frozen meat and pig feet

loans.name: Badassawé

texts.fr: O. gnao est une dame âgée de 35 ans, elle est couturière, elle exerce son activité dans son atelier de couture qu'elle a appelé " BEAUTE D'AFRIQUE". elle fait ce commerce depuis 2003. elle a des apprentis couturière, elle a besoin de s'acheter une nouvelle machine de couture pour livrer plus rapidement ses clients et mieux former ses apprentis. c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite un crédit pour l'achat d'une nouvelle machine à coudre. elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. O. Gnao is a 35-year old woman. She is a seamstress. She has her own shop which she has named “Beaute d’Afrique” [Africa’s Beauty]. She has been in this business since 2003, and now has apprentices. In order to better train them and to deliver the customers’ orders more quickly, she needs a new sewing machine. Thus she is requesting a loan to purchase a new sewing machine. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Dolele Jiguen Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DOLELE JIGUEN est né le 20 décembre 2010. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues du même village. Les membres ont décidé de se regrouper au sein du même groupe par  voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageoise de KOUNOUNE AIR FRANCE

Madame KHOUDIA N., debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, emmitouflée d’une écharpe, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 60 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants en charge. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de produits halieutiques, de vaisselles et de friperie. Elle pratique cette activité depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’accroître son activité en achetant plus de marchandises et réaliser plus de bénéfices. 

Son objectif est de payer la scolarité de son enfant cadet et de participer à la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
The DOLELE JIGUEN solidarity group was created on December 20, 2010. It consists of eleven women from the same village. The members formed the group based on proximity and affinity. It is part of the Banc Villageois of KOUNOUNE AIR FRANCE. Mrs. KHOUDIA N., standing on the far right end and wrapped in a scarf, is the head of the group. She is 60 years old, married and the mother of four children in her care. She runs a small business selling fish products, dinnerware and used clothing. She has been doing this ever since she joined the Banc Villageois. Her new loan will allow her to boost her activities by acquiring additional stocks and increasing her profits. She plans to pay for her youngest child’s tuition and some daily expenses.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish products, dinnerware, and used clothing

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
Fernando es unj padre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos menores hijos en el sector Las Delicias del distrito de Oyotún, una zona agrícola ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, se caracteriza por poseer tierras fértiles y muy accidentadas debido a su cercanía a la sierra norte del país.

Se dedica desde hace mas de diez años a actividades relacionadas con la agricultura, el cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en el cual suele sembrar algunos granos como maíz. Adicionalmente  se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, esta actividad le permite agenciarse de ingresos permanentes ya que la agricultura solo le brinda ingresos durante cada campaña de cosecha.

Fernando desea mejorar la alimentacion de sus animales para porder obtener mayores ingresos al momento de venderlos, para lograr su meta se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Fernando es un padre que siempre da lo mejor de si para poder sacar adelante a su familia, las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien tranquilo, trabajador y responsable. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Fernando is a 35-year-old father who lives with his wife and their two small children. They live in the Las Delicias area in the district of Oyotún. This is an agricultural area that is situated more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo – the area is characterized as being fertile and very hilly due to its proximity to the mountains in the northern part of the country. For more than ten years Fernando has made a living from farming-related activities. He has his own plot of land on which he typically grows grains such as corn. In addition, Fernando makes a living raising and selling small animals. This activity allows him to earn an income year-round, in contrast to growing crops, which only provides him with an income at harvest time. Fernando wants to improve the diet of his animals so that he can increase his earnings when he sells them. That is why he is requesting a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa. He wants to use the money to invest in balanced animal feed. Fernando is a father who always does as much as he can to help his family get ahead in life. The people who know him consider him to be someone who is calm, hard working, and responsible. He has worked with our organization before and has shown punctuality and responsibility in making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing balanced feed for the animals he sells.

loans.name: Brenda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Brenda lo conforman Brenda Irene B., Esther Martínez Mendoza y Martha Esperanza M. tres personas con deseos de salir adelante. La coordinadora, doña Brenda, se dedica desde hace 20 años al comercio de ropa y zapatos.

Las otras integrantes, Esther quien es la más novata en materia de comercio, se dedica a la venta de ropas usada apenas hace un año y Martha se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa usada desde hace 10 años. Ellas con el crédito otorgado invertirán más en materiales e insumos para mejorar sus negocios y seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The group Brenda is made up of Brenda Irene B., Esther Martínez Mendoza and Martha Esperanza M., 3 people who want to move forward. The coordinator, Brenda, has been selling clothes and shoes for 20 years. The other members are Esther, who is a novice in the field of commerce, has worked selling used clothes for a year, and Martha has sold cosmetics and used clothes for 10 years. With the loan they are seeking the members will invest in more materials and products to improve their businesses and move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials and products

loans.name: Kossi Biova

texts.fr: M. est un jeune célibataire qui a entamé en 2007 le commerce de d'appareils électronique tels que les magnétoscopes, les lecteurs et la vente de CD. ce commerce est florissant pour lui, la demande actuelle est élevée . il demande un deuxième crédit à WAGES pour pouvoir acheter divers appareils électroniques et  des CD pour satisfaire tous ses clients
texts.en:
M. is a young bachelor who began to sell small electricals such as radios, music players and CDs in 2007. Business is booming for him, thanks to increased consumer demand. He is seeking a second loan from WAGES in order to purchase more electrical goods and CDs so that he may satisfy this demand.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing small electricals and CDs

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO est né le 20 décembre 2010. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues du même village. Les membres ont décidé de se regrouper au sein du même groupe parce qu’elles habitent le même quartier et ont des affinités. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageoise de KOUNOUNE AIR FRANCE

Madame Amy P., debout à droite de la photo, avec un foulard autour de la taille, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants.

Elle est détentrice d’une boutique où elle vend du riz, de l’huile végétale des condiments pour cuisine etc. 

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renflouer sa boutique en marchandises afin d’accroître son activité et réaliser plus de bénéfices. 

Son objectif est de participer au bien-être de ses enfants et de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
The DEGGO solidarity group was created on the 20th December 2010. It is made up of 12 women from the same village. The group's members decided to unite because of their proximity and similar interests. They are members of the Kounoune Air France credit association. Madame Amy P., standing at the right of the picture with a scarf around her waist, is the group leader. She is a 37 year old married mother of four. She owns a shop, selling rice, vegetable oil and cooking condiments. The new loan will enable her to restock her shop with goods in order to generate higher revenues. Her aim is to improve her children's living conditions and help her husband with family duties.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, vegetable oil and cooking condiments

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 48 años, convive con su pareja Antonio de 57 años, con quien tiene 3 hijos y de los cuales sólo vive con uno de ellos, en su casa propia. Desde hace 18 años siembra arveja, papa, gladiolo y maíz, en terrenos que posee, en donde además cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo. Paralelamente cría caballos y asnos que le ayudan a trasladar sus insumos y herramientas hacía los campos que trabajará durante el día. Yolanda, le gusta sembrar arveja y gladiolos porque son productos con mayor demanda en el mercado, principalmente en épocas festivas, sin embargo le es pesado tener que trasladar lo que cosechó y pagar el traslado, pero sabe que de ello depende para vender sus frutos. En esta última campaña de cosecha, llevó su producción al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Lima, logrando ganar mayores ingresos económicos. Para su futuro, desea sembrar en mayor cantidad arvejas e instalar una tienda de venta de comestibles en su casa. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, y está feliz de continuar laborando con los integrantes de su banco comunal, pues conoce su metodología de trabajo que le gusta mucho. Con el crédito que solicita, lo piensa invertir en la compra de dos bolsas de semilla de arveja.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 48, lives with her partner Antonio, 57, with whom she has 3 children, of which only one lives with them in their own home. For 18 years she has grown peas, potatoes, gladioli and maize on the land she owns, counting on the help of her husband. Parallel to this she has also raised horses and donkeys, who help her to transport her products and tools to the land where she works during the day. Yolanda likes growing peas and gladioli because they are the products in greatest demand in the market, particularly during festival times. Without question it's difficult for Yolanda to have to transport what she harvests and to pay for the transport, but she knows that her profits depend on this. In the most recent harvest season Yolanda took her product to the wholesale market in Lima where she received better economic returns. In the future Yolanda wants to grow peas in a larger quantity and install a food sale business in her house. This is her second loan with MFP, and she is happy to continue working with the members of her communal bank as they know her working methodology which she likes very much. With the loan she is seeking Yolanda thinks to invest in the purchase of 2 bags of pea seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pea seeds

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge de 24 años, vive en Primavera de Duran ( zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución a las afuera de Guayaquil), trabaja como servicio al cliente en la mañana y tarde, pero en las noches se dedica a vender comida para tener oto ingreso adicional. 

Después de llegar de su trabajo de servicio al clientes, el va a cocinar en su casa para vender en la noche hamburguesa, papas con pollo frito y colas. Las vende hasta las 22h00pm. Aunque no tienen hijos ni esta casado el quiere ahorrar dinero para construir mejor su casa ya que es de caña y tablas. 

Con el préstamo el quiere comprar cemento, bloques y hierros para construir mejor su casa. En el futuro quiere tener su casa terminada y dedicarse solo a su negocio.
texts.en:
Jorge is 24 years old and lives in Primera de Duran (a semi-urban zone with a crumbling ecology on the outskirts of Guayaquil). He works providing a transport service in the morning and afternoon, but at night he works selling food in order to have another income. After arriving from his transport work, Jorge goes to his house to cook hamburgers and fried chicken with potatoes, to sell later at night. He sells food until 10pm. Although he doesn't have children and isn't married he wants to save money to improve his house, which is made from reeds and planks. With this loan Jorge wants to buy cement, blocks and tools to better construct his house. In the future he wants to finish his house and dedicate himself solely to his business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement and blocks

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To improve her business by purchasing additional cartons of plastic bowls

loans.name: Mokk Pooc Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité MOKK POOC est né le 20 décembre 2010. Il est composé de 07 femmes issues du même village. Les membres se sont organisés par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageoise de KOUNOUNE AIR FRANCE

Madame Fatou G. debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, levant la main droite, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois enfants en charge. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de tissus, de chaussures et de miel. Elle pratique cette activité depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augment son niveau d’approvisionnement en tissus, en chaussures et en miel afin d’accroitre ses bénéfices.

Elle a comme objectif de participer à la prise en charge de la dépense quotidienne de la famille et la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
The Mokk Pooc solidarity group was created on the 20th of December 2010. It is made up of 7 women from the same village who came together through neighbours and friends. They are members of the Kounoune Air France credit association. Madame Fatou G., standing at the far right of the photo, waving her right hand, is the group leader. She is a 51 year-old married mother of three. Since becoming a member of the credit association she has sold fabric, shoes and honey for a living. With the new loan she aims to boost her stock levels in order to generate more revenue. Her aim is to help with the family expenses and her children's schooling.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes, fabric and honey

loans.name: Helen Group

texts.en:
Helen T., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Helen Group. Helen is 41 years old, married, and has seven children between four and 24 years old. She also cares for one sibling. She was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to lack of financial support. For three years, she has been selling soft drinks and water on Benson Street, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 45,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more crates of soft drinks and more gallons of water. She describes herself as an earnest woman. Her dream is to grow her business, build a house, and educate her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Sopherger is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy crates of soft drinks and water to sell.

loans.name: Dédé Sikavi

texts.fr: A. dédé est une jeune femme célibataire de 22 ans qui pour subvenir à ses propres besoins s'est lancée en 2009 dans le commerce de tissus. l'activité évolue bien cela s'explique par la demande élevée de sa clientèle. elle exerce son commerce dans le marché local de hedzranawoé. Elle s'approvisionne en tissus dans ce même marché. elle voudrait s'approvisionner pour satisfaire ses clients. elle demande alors à WAGES son tout premier crédit pour l'achat de tissus.
texts.en:
A. Dédé is a young single lady, aged 22. In order to see to her everyday needs she began to sell fabric for a living in 2009. Trade is doing well, thanks to growing customer demand. She sells her goods from the local market at Hedzranawoé and sources her wares from the same place. She would like to increase her stock levels, and so is seeking a loan from WAGES to buy more fabric.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fabric

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK JOM est né le 20 décembre 2010. Il est composé de 06 femmes issues du même village. Les membres ont décidé de se regrouper au sein du même groupe parce qu’elles habitent le même quartier et ont des affinités. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageoise de KOUNOUNE AIR FRANCE

Madame Rosalie T., à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Elle divorcée et vit avec son unique enfant. 

Elle fait de l’aviculture. Elle tient un poulailler où elle élève des poulets de chaire.

Avec son crédit de 165.000 franc CFA elle va développer un élevage de 70 sujets. Sur ce elle va acheter des poussins, de l’aliment de volaille et des produits vétos.

Son objectif est d’assurer le payement des factures d’électricité et d’eau et d’envoyer de la nourriture à ses parents qui sont à son village d’origine.
texts.en:
The Bokk Jom solidarity group was created on the 20th December 2010. It is made up of 6 women from the same village who decided to come together through friendship and family ties. They are a part of the Kounoune Air France credit association. Madame Rosalie T., at the far right of the photo, is the group leader. She is 49 years old, divorced and lives with her only child. She is involved in poultry farming and owns a henhouse where she breeds chickens for meat. With a 165,000 CFA loan she is going to set up a henhouse for 70, buy chicks, chickenfeed and related products. Her aim is to pay the electricity and water bills and to send food to her parents who live in her home village.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 70 chicks and chickenfeed

loans.name: Potential Women Group

texts.en:
Patricia J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Potential Women. Patricia is 32 years old, single, and has five children who range from five to 15 years old. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. She cares for three siblings. For 16 years, she has been selling dried fish on Water Street, downtown Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more fish. She describes herself as a hard-working woman. Her dream is to improve her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more fish.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: Lucila, de 46 años, es una mujer laboriosa que está casada con Donato de 49 años, ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero sólo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Sabe que los esfuerzos que ejerce en el buen cuidado de sus cultivos, son fundamentales para obtener una cosecha productiva, por eso cada mañana contenta se dirige a la chacra para cuidar sus plantaciones de café, plátanos y palta, pensando que su sacrificio será recompensado. Lleva 25 años labrando la tierra junto a su esposo y ambos practican diferentes técnicas agrícolas que les dan buenos resultados. Lo que más le gusta de la agricultura, es la cosecha sobre todo recolectar los granos de café, pese que le resulta difícil trasladar sus productos hacía el mercado de su ciudad y hacía los centros de acopio, lo considera muy rentable por los beneficios que le genera. Por eso planea comprar más terrenos, donde pueda incrementar su productividad de café, por el buen precio que obtiene en el mercado. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y manifiesta que desde entonces tiene progreso económico, por eso continuará pagando responsablemente sus cuotas para acceder a más créditos que la hagan crecer, pues además le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcir sobre sus plantaciones y nivelar su producción.
texts.en:
Lucila is a hard-working 46 year old woman. She is married to Donato, 49, and they have 4 children, though only one still lives with them in the home they own. Lucila knows that her work taking care of her crops is crucial to a good harvest, and so every morning she is happy to head for the fields to take care of her coffee, bananas and avocados, thinking that her efforts will be rewarded. She has spent 25 years working the land with her husband, and each of them has their own special methods for getting good results. What Lucila likes most about farming is harvesting the coffee beans. Although it is difficult to get the crop to market in the city and to have it stored, she considers it a very profitable business. It fetches a good price at the market. Lucila is therefore planning to buy additional land where she can increase her coffee production. This is her third loan with [field partner] MFP, and she can see the economic progress she has made already. She will continue to make her repayments responsibly because she wants to continue accessing credit to help her bsiness grow - and because she enjoys being part of this communal bank. With the loan she is seeking, Lucila will buy sacks of organic fertilizer to spread on her crops and increase productivity.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: A. komi est un homme de 35 ans, il est marié et père d'un enfant, il vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de kégué qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. il s'est lancée en 2005 dans le commerce en gros de biscuits et de bonbons. aujourd'hui il dispose d'une clientèle assez importante. il s'approvisionne au ghana voisin. ainsi il réalise plus de marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes.il a reçu des commandes et  voudrait un prêt chez WAGES pour se rendre à accra,une ville du GHANA pour s'approvisionner et venir satisfaire sa clientèle
texts.en:
Komi A. is 35 years-old, married and the father of one child. He lives with his family in the Kégué district, which is on the outskirts of the city of Lomé. In 2005, he began selling cookies and candy wholesale. Today he has a sizeable clientele. He gets his supplies in neighboring Ghana, thus making a larger profit margin on his sales. He has received some orders and would like a loan from WAGES in order to go to Accra, a city in GHANA, to stock up and satisfy his customers.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cartons of cookies and candy

loans.name: Sope Sa Jeker Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE SA JEKER est né le 20 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 05 femmes issues du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageoise de KOUNOUNE AIR France

Madame SAKOU K. à droite de la photo, levant la main gauche, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 39 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge.

Elle développe un petit commerce de vaisselles et de tissus. Elle pratique cette activité depuis son adhésion dans le Banc Villageois.

Son objectif est de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille. Elle soutient son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Sa Jeker was created on December 20, 2009. It is composed of five women living in the same village. They have decided to form a group together because they are friends and neighbors. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of Kounoune Air France. Mrs. Sakou Kanei, to the far right in the photo and raising her left hand, is the group’s leader. She is 39 years old. She is married and the mother of five dependent children. Her business is selling dishes and textiles. She has been in this line of business since joining Banc Villageois. Her goal is to help improve her family’s life conditions. She helps her husband provide for the family needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing textiles and dishes

loans.name: Sanlevo

texts.fr: G. est une femme mariée, elle vit avec son époux dans le quartier de hedzranawoé à Lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce des oeufs. elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la petite localité d'agbodrafo. sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes dont la majorité sont des restaurateurs.elle est en rupture de stock, elle sollicite un premier prêt pour se réapprovisionner avec 100 plateaux d'oeufs.
texts.en:
Ms. G. is a married woman who lives with her husband in the Hedzranawoé district in Lomé. She has a revenue-generating business involving eggs. She gets her supplies from the country's interior in the small town of Agbodrafo. Her customer base includes anyone, most of whom are restauranteurs. She is out of stock and is requesting an initial loan in order to stock up again with 100 trays of eggs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying eggs

loans.name: Rosa Violeta

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 57 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo en el sector El Espinal del distrito de Oyotún, un distrito agrícola situado a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, se caracteriza por poseer tierras fértiles y un terreno accidentado dada su cercania con la sierra norte del país.

Se dedica desde hace mas de treinta años a la agricultura, ella cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar arroz, cabe resaltar que la zona posee abundante agua en sus canales de regadío por lo que este cultivo se siembra dos veces al año, a diferencia de la mayor parte de los distritos de la región que solo lo siembran una vez al año.

Esta actividad es una fuente bastante importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre trabaja arduamente de modo que pueda conseguir una buena cosecha, precisamente, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas.

Su mas grande anhelo es seguir trabajando para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, Rosa es una persona tranquila, responsable y muy trabajadora, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran alguien de confianza.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 57 year old mother who lives with her husband in the El Espinal area of Oyotún, an agricultural district located 2 hours away from the city of Chiclayo. The area is known for its fertile land, and to the rugged terrain it owes to its proximity to the mountains in the north of the country. Rosa has spent more than 30 years working in agriculture. She has a plot of land on which she grows rice, and which has so much water for its irrigation channels that she is able to plant twice a year. Most rice-growing districts in the region are able to plant just one crop per year. Rice-growing is very important to the family's income, so she always works hard to ensure a good harvest. To achieve her aim of a good harvest, Rosa has decided to seek a loan for the first time, of 2000 soles ($725) from Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to invest it in the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides. Her greatest wish is to go on working to be able to improve her family's quality of life. Rosa is a calm, responsible and very hard-working woman, and her neighbours regard her as a reliable, trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides that will improve the rice crop

loans.name: By God In Power Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “By God In Power” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to boost their businesses. 

Salamatu J. who is pictured on the left is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Salamatu is twenty-five years old, married, with one child who is still not of school-going age. Salamatu sells groundnuts/peanuts and firewood.  With the help of this loan, she will expand her business by buying more groundnuts and firewood to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy more groundnuts and firewood

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 47 años, es un padre de familia muy sincero y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Eugenia de 47 años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
