Cuando era niño, los padres de Carlos le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, él se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha café y plátano, para luego venderlos en el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de las plagas de insectos que afectan la producción. Desea comprarse un carro, para que pueda transportar sus productos cosechados. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Carlos, 47, is a sincere and happy father. He lives with his wife Eugenia, also 47, and their two beloved children, to whom he wants to give a better quality of life. When he was a boy, Carlos' parents taught him everything he needed to know about farming. Over time he took charge of more and more of his parents' land. Now he has a large area under cultivation, where he grows cofee and bananas to sell in the market in the city of La Merced. What he likes most about his work is cultivating the land where he grows food for his family. It has taken him 12 years to get to where he is today. What he considers most difficult is protecting his crops from the insect pests that reduce his harvest. One day he would like to buy himself a car so that he can transport his produce. this is the third loan Carlos has had from MFP. He has always been very punctual with his repayments and hopes to remain so. He is trusted as a member of his communal bank. With the 1500 soles he is requesting, he will buy fertilizer for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Kerlys Karina

texts.es:
Kerlys de 26 años, tiene un taller de costura/confección y vive en las Orquídeas de Guayaquil (zona urbana, llamada las orquídeas porque en su descubrimiento habían muchas flores orquídeas).  

Comenzó a trabajar en un colegio pero como quería independizarse y pasar mas tiempo con sus dos hijos decidió ubicar en su casa un taller de costura y confección, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener su taller. Ahora trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 16h00pm todos los días. 

Para poder continuar con su trabajo necesita comprar hilos, telas y herramientas para su taller de costura, en el futuro quiere tener su propia marca de ropa y distribuir ropa al por mayor a almacenes.
texts.en:
Kerlys, 26 years old, has a sewing shop and lives in Orquideas de Guayaquil (urban area named "orchids" because there were many such flowers there at the time of its discovery). She started working in a school but wanted to work independently and spend more time with her two children. She decided to build a sewing shop in her house, little by little she was able to. She now works from 8am to 4pm every day. In order to continue working she needs to buy thread, fabric and tools for her shop. In the future she want to have her own clothing brand and distribute clothing wholesale to stores.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric, thread

loans.name: Saral

texts.en:
This is 36 year-old Saral N.. She is married and has 4 children aged 14, 11, 10 and 7. In 2005, she established  her agriculture business.  Working 7 days a week and 7 hours a day, she supports her family. She will use her loan for cultivation. In the future, Saral plans to increase her income from agriculture. She thanks you for your support.   

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seeds and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: increase investment in farming

loans.name: United Brothers Group

texts.en: Henry S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called United Brothers. Henry is 26 years old, single and has one child who is two years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to lack of financial support. For 5 years, he has been selling medicated ointment on Mechlin Street, in downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 16,250 Liberian Dollars portion of this 81,250 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of medicated ointment. Henry describes himself as a jovial person. His dream is to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of medicated ointment.

loans.name: Tataesusai Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Tataesusai” group from Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. These are petty businesswomen who want a loan of SLL 500,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of their SLL 500,000 loan, they will be able to add more goods to their business inventories, make more sales, and improve their living conditions.

Isatu C. (left) is the leader of this group. Isatu is married and has six children – three in primary school and three in secondary school. Isatu sells rice, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), peppers, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy rice, palm oil, peppers, etc. in large quantity to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, peppers, etc. in large quantity

loans.name: Jacinta Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jacinta está conformado por tres mujeres maduras que luchan para llevar un mayor sustento a su núcleo familiar; doña Jacinta del Rosario L. Vásquez, quien es la coordinadora posee desde hace 5 años un kiosco donde vende una gran variedad de productos y que ha mejorado y crecido mucho en el último año. Ella destinará el crédito para efectuar mejoras en la infraestructura del negocio.

Las otras miembros del grupo son doña Rosa Adilia R. y Darling Amplié; la primera posee una pastelería pequeña desde hace un año y la segunda un puesto de tortillería en su casa donde también vende frijoles cocidos y helados desde hace año y medio. Ambas destinarán el dinero a la compra de materiales y productos para la venta.
texts.en:
The Jacinta group is comprised of three mature women who struggle to bring greater support to their families. Jacinta del Rosario L. Vásques is the coordinator of the group. For five years she has had a kiosk where she sells a great variety of products. Her business has improved and grown a lot in the last year. She will use the loan to make improvements in the infrastructure of her business. The other members of the group are Adilia R. and Darling Amplié. The first one has had a small pastry shop for one year. The second one has a tortilla stand in her house, where she also sells cooked beans and ice cream. She has had this business for one and a half years. Both of them will use the money to buy materials and products to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements on the business

loans.name: Surchase Group

texts.en: Patience S., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Surchase Group. Patience is 28 years old, married and has two children aged two and 10. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. She cares for one sibling. For 5 years, she has been selling sausage in Waterside Market, Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cartons of sausage. She describes herself as very friendly woman. Her goal is to grow her business. In the photo, Rose A. is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of sausage

loans.name: Takku Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIGGUEY a comme mot d’ordre le travail. Il est né la veille de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA COKI1 en décembre 2009. Il est composé de 11 femmes griottes qui partagent la même zone géographique et même quartier. 

Madame Leyla S., à l’extrême droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge et 1 autre qui lui est confié par des proches. 

Elle développe un petit commerce de colliers en perles, de l’encens et des petits pagnes. 

Avec son actuel crédit elle va renforcer son niveau d’approvisionnement en marchandises afin d’augmenter ses bénéfices.

Son objectif est de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins personnels et de soutenir son mari dans ses responsabilités familiales.
texts.en:
Work is the motto of the TAKKU LIGGUEY solidarity group. It was created at the inauguration of the SANTHIABA COKI1 Banc Villageois in December 2009. It is composed of 15 "griotte" women (trustees of oral culture) who share the same geographic area and even the same neighborhood. Mrs. Leyla S., at the extreme right in the photo, is the leader of the group. She is 55 years old, married and the mother of 7 dependent children. One other child is entrusted to her care by close relatives. She has developed a small business selling pearl necklaces, incense and "petit pagnes" (decorative cloths wrapped around the hips). With her current loan, she is going to expand her suppL. of merchandise in order to increase her profit. Her objective is to be able to provide for her personal needs and to help her husband with the familial responsibilities.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pearl necklaces, incense and " petits pagnes."

loans.name: Fight For Progress Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Fight for Progress” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is not the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. However, with the help of this new loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Alimamy K.. Alimamy is now age twenty-eight; he was born in Magburaka town where he lives with his wife and one child. Alimamy’s wife is a businesswoman and his child is still not of school-going age. 

For four years now, Alimamy has been running an Internet café wherein he also does photocopying for a fee. Alimamy will use his share of this loan to expand his business. He will use it to buy some stationery, pay internet connection fees, etc.

loans.use: buy some stationery, pay internet connection fees, etc.

loans.name: Try For Me Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Try For Me” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Marie K. is the leader of this group. The thirty-five-year-old is married to a miner and they have four children. Marie has been a businesswoman for many years now, she sells rice, palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), groundnuts/peanuts, etc. With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, groundnuts, etc.

loans.name: Islam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité ISLAM a vu le jour la veille de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA COKI 1 en decembre 2009. Il regroupe 12 femmes entrepreneurs, généreuses dans l’effort et qui ont en commun le culte du travail. Des femmes qui gagnent honnêtement leur vie.

Madame Ndèye Mané DIAKHATE, à l’extrême droite de la photo, sac à la main portant des lunettes de vue est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 32 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants en charge.
 
Elle fait une activité de restauration : le matin elle vend le petit déjeuner (café, pain, lait, mayonnaise, niébé etc.) et le soir elle vend du « café Touba »

Avec son crédit elle va augmenter son achat en provisions pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle et accroitre sa marge bénéficiaire. 

Son objectif est de pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins personnels et aider son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille (santé, nourriture et scolarité des enfants)
texts.en:
The ISLAM solidarity group was created in December 2009 on the eve of the inauguration of the SANTHIABA COK1 Banc Villageois. It consists of 12 businesswomen who give of themselves generously and share the cult of work. They are women who earn an honest living. Mrs. Ndèye Mané DIAKHATE is the head of the group. She is at the far right of the photo, holding a bag and wearing eyeglasses. She is 32 years old, married and the mother of five children in her care. She runs a restaurant where she serves breakfast in the morning (coffee, bread, milk, mayonnaise, black-eyed peas, etc.) and “café Touba” (a traditional coffee beverage) in the evening. With her loan, she plans to increase her stocks of groceries to better satisfy her customers and boost her profits. Her goal is to be able to support herself and help her husband with the family’s needs (health care, food and tuition for the children).

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 30 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su querida hija Elizabeth de 12 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Los arduos trabajos que realiza Lidia en su chacra, han hecho que sus cultivos estén muy bien cuidados y que los días de venta, sus productos sean rápidamente comprados. Su principal fuente de ingresos, es la venta de plátano y café, siendo estos productos de muy buena calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que siente que su trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 12 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas de insectos que pueden afectar su producción. Con el tiempo, desea adquirir nuevas tierras, para ampliar sus cultivos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y nunca ha tenido problemas con su grupo comunal, en donde es la encargada de poner la cuota de alegría que mantiene a las demás socias muy felices. Con los dos mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar sus plantaciones.
texts.en:
Lidia, 30, is a very cheerful and hardworking woman. She lives at her parents' with her beloved 12-year-old daughter Elizabeth, who is the reason behind all of her efforts. Her hard work in the fields means that her crops are very well looked after and that on selling days her products are quickly bought. Her main source of income is the sale of good quality bananas and coffee. What she most likes about her job is the harvest, which makes her feel like her work is paying off. She has been in this line of work for 12 years and she believes that the hardest thing is to protect her crops from insect pests that can affect production. Over time she wants to acquire new lands to expand her crops. This is her third loan with MFP. She has been very prompt in her payments and has never had any issues with her loan group, where she is the one to bring in the joy that makes other members very happy. With the two thousand five hundred soles she is requesting she plans to buy more fertilizer to improve her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags of fertiliser.

loans.name: Tatasuthekeh Group

texts.en:
Sallay K. (pictured second from left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Sallay was born in Mile 91, a small town in Northern Sierra Leone.  She is married with five children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending school – two in primary school and three in secondary school. Sallay has been a businesswoman for seventeen years now. Currently, Sallay sells ready-to-wear-clothes, shoes and locally produced food items. With a loan of SLL 1,000,000 she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current stock.

This is not the first loan that members of this group have enjoyed from SMT/Kiva lenders. Previous Kiva loans have created significant impacts in the lives of these borrowers. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again seeking a new loan of SLL 1,000,000. With the help of this loan, they will be able to further expand their businesses, make more sales, and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy ready-to-wear-clothes, shoes and locally produced food items

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis Alberto es un padre de familia que tiene 27 años de edad, tiene un hijo y vive junto a su familia en el sector Las Delicias del distrito de Oyotún, un distrito agrícola situado a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, se caracteriza por tener tierras fértiles y una geografía accidentada, dada su cercanía con la sierra norte del país.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura, especificamente en la crianza y venta de animales desde hace mas de cinco años, el suele criar animales menores (aves de corral, ovinos) para luego ofrecerlas en venta con los negociantes que suelen frecuentar la zona en donde vive o también en una feria que se realiza una vez por semana en el distrito de Cayaltí (a una hora de distancia)

Luis Alberto desea mejorar la alimentación de sus animales de modo que estos puedan desarrollarse de mejor manera y a la vez sean vendidos a mejor precio, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Luis Alberto es alguien tranquilo y trabajador, el trata de esforzarse siempre para poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive es considerado por sus vecinos y conocidos como alguien honrado y de confianza.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto is a 27-year old family man with one child. He lives with his family in the Las Delicias area in the Oyotún district, an agricultural district located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. The area has has a fertile land and rugged terrain, given its proximity to the mountains north of the country. He works in activities related to agriculture, specifically in the breeding and sale of animals, which he has been doing for over five years. He usually raises small animals (poultry, sheep) which he sells to the dealers who come to the area where he lives or also in a fair that takes place once a week in the district of Cayaltí (an hour away). Luis Alberto wants to improve the feed he gives to his animals so that they develop better and can be sold at a better price. To achieve his goal he has had to request a 1000 soles loan to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time. He plans to invest the loan in the purchase of balanced feed. Luis Alberto is quiet and hardworking. He always tries hard to provide his family with a better quality of life. In the area where he lives he is seen by neighbours and acquaintances as someone honest and trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced feed to improve the breeding of small animals for sale.

loans.name: And Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité AND LIGG. est né le jour de l’assemblée constitutive du Banc Village de SANTHIABA COKI1 en décembre 2009. Il regroupe 11 femmes qui partagent le même quartier. Elles sont unies par des liens agissants de solidarité et de voisinage.

Madame Mariama N. à droit sur la photo est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée sans enfant mais a adopté deux enfants. 

Son activité consiste la vente de tissus basin, tissus Khartoum et tissus basin. Depuis des années elle exerce cette activité. Par ailleurs, elle est entrain de s’initier peu à peu à la coupe et à la couture.

Son crédit lui permettra d’acheter en quantité importante des tissus afin de satisfaire sa clientèle d’une part et réaliser plus de bénéfices d’autre part.

Avec ce prêt reçu, elle vise à accroitre son chiffre d’affaire, aider son mari à prendre en charge la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants
texts.en:
The AND LIGG. solidarity group was born on the day of the Founding General Meeting of the SANTHIABA COKI1 “Banc Village” in December 2009. It brings together 11 women who live in the same neighborhood. They are linked to each other by solidarity and neighborhood ties. Mrs. Mariama N. on the right hand side of the photo is 38 years old. She is married and has no children but has adopted two. Her business consists in selling Basin and Khartoum fabrics. She has been running this business for years. In addition, she is learning gradually the skills of cutting and sewing. Her loan will enable her to purchase a large amount of fabric in order to meet her customers' needs and make more profits. With this loan, she aims to increase her income, help her husband cover food and healthcare needs as well as the children's tuition fees.

Translated from French by Marie-Elodie Bazy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Rabina

texts.en:
This is 26 year old Rabina N.. She is married and has no children. In 2005, she established her agriculture business, and works 7 days a week and 8 hours a day to support her family. She used her most recent loan to increase her investment in cultivation.  In the future, Rabina plans to promote her agriculture business. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To increase investment in agriculture.

loans.name: Temtemneh Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 800,000, they will be able to add more stock to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feeding and clothing them better. 

Mariama L. is the leader of this group. She was born in Magburaka and she is now thirty-two years of age. Mariama is married and has five children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending secondary and primary schools. 

Mariama sells batteries, toothpaste, bars of soap, rice, etc. She has been a businesswoman for five years now. With the help of this loan, she will expand her business by buying the above-mentioned items wholesale.

loans.use: Buy batteries, toothpaste, bars of soap, rice, etc.

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es:
Isabel de 40 años, ella vende productos de uso personal como cosméticos por catalogo de marca Avon ( empresa que ayuda a mujeres emprendedoras a vender cosméticos a un bajo costo), ella vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil(zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales). 

Ella inicio con las ventas de cosméticos Avon para tener ingresos suficientes y así dales una mejor vida a sus dos hijos que estudian en escuelas fiscales. Vende maquillaje, perfumes, cremas, desodorantes a un bajo costo por catalogo. Ella vende los productos a sus conocidos y vecinos. 

Para incrementar su mercadería ella quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, maquillaje, cremas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y tener un local de los productos Avon.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is 40 years old. She sells personal care products, such as cosmetics, through the Avon catalogue (the company helps female entrepreneurs to sell cosmetics at a low cost). She lives in the suburb of Guayaquil (urban area, most residents are small traders). She started selling Avon cosmetics in order to have sufficient income and thus give her two sons, who attend public schools, a better life. She sells make-up, perfumes, creams and deodorants at a low cost through a catalogue. She sells the goods to her friends and neighbors. In order to increase her stock she plans to use the loan to buy perfumes, make-up and creams for her business. In future she wants to finish building her house and own an Avon product store.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy perfume, make-up and creams.

loans.name: Nor Forget Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Nor Forget” group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the northern town of Magburaka. This will be their first loan from SMT/Kiva.  With the help of this loan, these entrepreneurs will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standards will improve, they can at least provide three meals a day for their children, pay their schools fees, buy them clothes to wear, and pay their medical bills in case any of them falls sick. 

Alie T. (right) is the leader of this group. Alie was born in a place call Makeni Lol. He is thirty-seven years of age, married to a businesswoman and they have four children. 

Alie sells palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), rice and cigarettes. He has been running this business for four years now. Alie will use this loan to expand his business. He will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buys palm oil, rice and cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee, de 35 años, es una mujer muy sincera y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Elmer de 40 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Emerson de 9 y Medali de 2 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. La bodega de Haydee es la primera en abrirse en su Pueblo, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su bodega, no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lleva 9 años en este negocio y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el décimo crédito con MFP y espera poder pagar a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarles problemas a las compañeras de su grupo comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los tres mil soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Haydee is 35 years old. She is a sincere and cheerful woman and she lives in her own home with her husband Elmer, 40, and their two beloved children, Emerson, 9 and Medali, 2. They are the reason for all of their hard work. Haydee's convenience store is the first one to open in her town. Her doors are open at 6 am ready to welcome her early rising customers. They know the variety of her store's merchandise and they trust her because they know taht they are going to find what they need. She has been in this business for 9 years and what she likes the most about the work is talking to her customers. In time, she hopes to grow her business and offer her customers a better service. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she expects to be able to make the payments on time, since she doesn't want to cause problems for the other group members. She s very respected in the group and she is very respected there and brings order to the group. With the three thousand soles that she is asking for, she will buy more products to outfit her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products to outfit her store.

loans.name: Malahka Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Malahka” group from Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 600,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their business inventories, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Aruna I. K. who is pictured on the left. Aruna  was born in Magburaka, thirty-two years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have  five children, four of whom are attending primary school. Aruna has been a businessman for twelve years now. He now sells salt, rice, sugar and caustic soda wholesale (by the bag). Aruna will use his share of the loan to buy more of the above-mentioned items to add to his business inventory.

loans.use: Buy salt, rice, sugar and caustic soda

loans.name: Cesar Augusto

texts.es:
Cesar es un padre de familia de 48 años de edad, tiene tres hijos menores y reside junto a ellos y a su esposa en el sector El Espinal, una zona rural del distrito agrícola de Oyotún, ubicado a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, se caracteriza por tener tierras fértiles y una geografía accidentada debido a su cercanía con la sierra norte del país.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la agricultura, cuenta con un terreno de cultivo en donde suele sembrar arroz, cabe resaltar que la zona posee abundante agua en sus canales de regadío por lo que este cultivo se siembra dos veces al año, a diferencia de la mayor parte de los distritos de la región que solo lo siembran una vez al año.

Esta actividad es una fuente bastante importante de ingresos para su familia por lo que siempre trabaja arduamente de modo que pueda conseguir una buena cosecha, precisamente, para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por priM. vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes y pesticidas.

Cesar es un hombre entregado a su familia, siempre trata de dar lo mejor de si para poder asegurarse ganancias que le permitan brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona donde vive es considerado alguien honesto y confiable.
texts.en:
Cesar is a 48 year old husband and father. He has three minor children and he lives with them and his wife in the El Espinal sector, a rural area in the agricultural district of Oyotún, located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. It is characterized by having fertile land and a diverse geography due to its closeness to the country's northern sierra. He has worked in farming for 10 years. He has land where he grows rice. It's worth mentioning that the area has a lot of water in its irrigation canals so this crop is planted twice a year, compared to most of the other districts in the region where they only plant once a year. This activity is an important source of income for his family so he always works very hard to get a good harvest. In order to attain his goal it has become necessary to ask Edpyme Alternativa, for the first time, for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles that he plans on investing in buying fertilizer and pesticide. Cesar is a man who is dedicated to his family. He always tries to give his best in order to ensure good earnings that will allow him to offer them a better quality of life. In the area where he lives he is considered honest and trustworthy.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice crop.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 42 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Marcos de 36 años y su única hija Yelisa de 13 años, quienes son el motivo principal de todos sus esfuerzos. Con mucho esfuerzo Carmen ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva papa y alverja, productos que luego lleva a vender al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lleva 4 años realizando esta actividad y aún disfruta mucho cuidar sus cultivos y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, espera mejorar su producción y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono, con lo cual espera mejorar su próxima cosecha.
texts.en:
Carmen is 42 years old and she is an unpretentious and hard working mom. She lives in her own house, together with her husband Marcos, 36, and their only daugther Yelisa, 13. They are the reason for her hard work. With a great deal of effort Carmen has worked the fields and made them fertile. She sows potatoes and peas and she sells the harvest on a wholesale basis in the city of Tarma. The income from the sales has granted them the necessary finances to support the family which is why she puts all she's got into her business. She has been harvesting for 4 years and she very much enjoys the work. The hardest part is distributing the product to the markets. The sacks are very heavy and make her very tired. In the future she would like to improve production to see better revenues. This is the eighth loan cycle with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has always been on time in the past and she is committed to being on time again. In her community group she is a very involved member, always on top of the group's business dealings. With the loan of one thousand nuevos soles she will invest in the purchase of fertilizer, so that the next harvest will be stronger.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Jamji Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité JAMJI  est né le 30 décembre 2009. Il regroupe 13 femmes courageuses et travailleuses. Et comme le nom du groupe l’indique « JAMJI » LA PAIX en français, elles ont des relations au beau fixe et elles sont unies par des liens de voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de SANTHIABA COKI1 

Awa Y., debout à droite sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est la doyenne du groupe, elle est âgée de 66 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 7 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 5 autres enfants. 

Elle achète des tissus pour les revendre dans son quartier et au marché. C’est une activité rentable au lendemain des fêtes religieuses (Korité et Tabaski) et aux cérémonies familières (baptêmes, mariages etc.) 

Avec son crédit de 65.000 francs CFA elle va acheter en quantité plus importante des tissus pour plus de clients et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.

Son objectif est de soutenir ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group JAMJI was born on December 30, 2009. It brings together thirteen courageous and hardworking women. The group's name JAMJI means "peace". The women of the group have a fine relationship and are united by community ties. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of SANTHIABA COKI1 Ms. Awa Y. is the group's leader (standing at the right in the photo). She is the most senior of the group. She is 66 years old, a widow, and the mother of seven children. She also has five other children in her care. Awa purchases cloth to resell in her district and at the market. It's a profitable business just before religious holidays (Korité and Tabaski) and family events (baptisms, marriages, etc.). With her loan of 65,000 francs CFA, Awa is going to buy larger quantities of cloth for more customers and to increase her profit margin. Her goal is to support her children and to provide for herself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cloth

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa de 64 años, hace 30 años atrás desde que inicio la cooperativa donde vive ubico el negocio de la tienda en su casa, ella vive en una zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución llamada “Primavera” de Duran. 

Ella tiene una tienda de víveres la mayor venta que tiene son los confites que vende y las bebidas, desde hace años ella ubico su tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, para mas seguridad le puso unas rejas (aparecen en la foto). Trabaja desde las 07h30 hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar confites y bebidas para su negocio, en el futuro quiere comprar un carro para transportar mejor la mercadería y así con los ingresos asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Rosa is 64 years old. Thirty years when the cooperative where she lives was established she set up a business in her home. She lives in a suburban area named Duran which is known for its ecology. She runs a greenhouse, selling plants on a wholesale basis. Rosa de 64 años, hace 30 años atrás desde que inicio la cooperativa donde vive ubico el negocio de la tienda en su casa, ella vive en una zona periurbana, con una ecología en disolución llamada “Primavera” de Duran. She runs a convenience store. The greatest demand is for confections and soft drinks. For years the store has taken up the front part of her house, but for greater security she installed bars (as seen on the photo). She works from 7:30 in the morning until 10 at night, every day. With the loan she wishes to purchase confections and drinks to stock her business. In the future she wishes to purchase a car to be able to transport her merchandise with greater ease. She hopes to save a pension for her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase confections and soft drinks.

loans.name: Go Before Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Go Before” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Isatu C. is the leader of this group. Isatu is fifty-seven years old and married with three children – two in primary school and one in secondary school. Isatu sells dishes and has been doing this business for many years now. With the help of this loan, Isatu will invest in her business by buying different kinds of dishes and in large quantity to add to her business inventory. 

(Also included in the photo is loan officer Zainab B., pictured in the right, handing over the loan.)

loans.use: Buy different kinds of dishes, in large quantity

loans.name: Pastef Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité PASTEF est né le jour de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois de SANTHIAB. COKI1. Outre le voisinage, les 14 femmes qui composent le groupe ont des liens de parenté, des relations excellentes et comme dénominateur commun l’amour du travail.

Madame Fary F., à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 53 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 6 autres enfants. 

Elle achète des légumes, des condiments pour cuisine (poivre, ail, piment etc) pour revendre au marché. 

Son crédit lui servira à renforcer son niveau d’approvisionnement en marchandises afin de générer plus de bénéfices. 

Son vœu est d’avoir un chiffre d’affaire consistant pour pouvoir aller dans les plus grands marchés hebdomadaires pour trouver davantage des légumes (oignons, choux, carottes etc.
texts.en:
The solidarity group PASTEF was born on inauguration day of the Banc Villageois of SANTHIAB. COKI1. Besides being neighbors, the fourteen women who compose the group have ties of kinship, an excellent relationship, and a love of work as a common denominator. Ms. Fary F. is the group's leader (found at the far right in the photo). She is 53 years old, married, and the mother of six children. She also has six other children to support. Fary buys vegetables and condiments (black pepper, garlic, chili peppers, etc.) to resell at the market. Her loan will be used to bolster her stock of merchandise in order to generate more profit. Fary's wish is to have substantial sales to be able to go to the biggest weekly markets and find more vegetables (onions, cabbage, carrots, etc.)

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Devloping and advancing her business

loans.name: Matenkay Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Matenkay” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Magburaka, a town in Northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Ramatu C.. Ramatu is age thirty-eight; she was born in Magburaka town where she is currently residing together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a businessman; two of her children are attending primary school and one is in secondary school. For ten years now, Ramatu has been selling ready-to-wear-clothes and shoes. She also sells Vaseline. With this loan, Ramatu will buy more ready-to-wear-clothes, shoes, and Vaseline wholesale to add to her business inventory.

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.)

loans.use: Buy ready-to-wear-clothes, shoes, and Vaseline wholesale for resale

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, D. 55 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Alonso D. 65 y su hijo menor Antony D. 20 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Las chacras D. Celia son las mejores cuidadas en el poblado D. Picoy, todas las mañanas, trabaja desD. muy temprano en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinD. a sus papas y alverjas dependerán los ingresos D. su familia. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es la libertad que tiene para pasear por los verdes campos D. su poblado, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus tierras D. las plagas D. insectos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar más tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su grupo comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta.
Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Celia is 55 years old. She is a very hard working, uncomplicated person. She lives in her own house together with her husband Alonso, 65, and their youngest son Antony, 20. She wants to give her family a better quality of life. The fields that Celia works are the best kept fields in the village of Picoy. Every day she works the fields from very early in the morning and she knows that the care she gives to the plantations of potatoes and peas will directly impact on the income earned for her family. What she likes best about her work is the freedom that she feels as she travels among the green fields in her village. She has been an agriculturer for the past 10 years. The hardest part about her work is keeping insect pests out of the harvest. In time she hopes to purchase more land so that she can increase her yield. This is her second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). With the one thousand nuevos soles she is requesting she will invest in the purchase of fertilizer for the plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban, de 49 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Esteban ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus platanales y cafetales, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de La Merced, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra todo el día, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para realizar otras actividades. Para más adelante, espera poder adecuar sus tierras para el sembrado de cítricos, ya que por estas fechas es el fruto que mejor se vende. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudara bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su grupo comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Esteban is 49 years old. He is a very hard working, uncomplicated person. He lives alone in his own home. His greatest wish is to improve his quality of life. Working arduously Esteban has managed to successfully reap his fields. Every day he wakes very early in the morning to irrigate and care for his banana and coffee plantations. He sells his harvest in the city of La Merced, location where he always gets the best revenues for his products. What he enjoys most about his work is being able to enjoy the freedom of working in his green fields. He has been an agriculturer for 30 years. The most difficult part about his work is the long hours of work, especially around this critical time of year when the harvest is in highest demand. This is the second loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He realizes that this loan will help him significantly in the progress of his business. He is committed to making his payments on time. As a member of his community group he is known to be very responsible and he is very well respected for this. Withthe one thousand soles that he is requesting he will purchase fertilizer for his plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: La Rutina Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario La Rutina está conformado por Elizabeth del Carmen M. G., Tania de los Ángeles Díaz y Jairo Ramón G. D., tres personas motivadas y con muchos deseos de superación. Elizabeth, la coordinadora es quien posee el negocio más grande de los tres, es una pulpería muy próspera que cuenta con muchos productos, muy diferente a la que tenía hace 2 años cuando inició con éste proyecto.

Jairo, se dedica a la venta de bisuterías y Tania, quien es la más joven (21 años), se dedica al trabajo en el puesto de tortillería heredado de su mamá. Ellos utilizarán el dinero para la compra de materiales y aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
The group named "La Rutina" is made up of Elizabeth del Carmen Membreno G., Tania de los Angeles Dias, and Jairo Ramon G. D., three very motivated individuals with great plans for self-improvement. Elizabeth is the coordinator and her business is the largest of the three. She runs a large grocery store, offering a wide variety of products. Her business is very different today than it was two years ago when she first started out. Jairo sells fashion jewelry and Tania, the youngest in the group (21 years old) sells tortillas. She inherited her business from her Mom. They will invest the funds from thsi loan in the purchase of merchandise and materials, and to use as working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cheese, fresh cheese, cream and cheese curds.

loans.name: Almohada Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está formado por tres mujeres de la tercera década que se encuentran en su segundo ciclo de créditos con ADIM, Nora B. quien es la coordinadora del grupo se dedica a la venta de panes y reposterías que ella misma elabora con ayuda de sus hijos desde hace un año. A pesar que ella alquila el horno en el que elabora sus productos ella invertirá el crédito en compra de materiales para poder crecer más en el negocio antes de construir ella su propio horno.

Daxnia Leticia H. H. quien es otra de las miembros se dedica a la venta de algunos abarrotes  y frijoles cocidos, por otro lado Lesbia Raquel Dávila A. comercializa productos cosméticos, perfumerías y utensilios del hogar de la compañía AVON. Ambas también invertirán el crédito en la compra de productos para la venta.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women and they are on their second loan cycle with ADIM (Kiva Field Partner). Nora Boltadano is the coordinator of the group and she sells fresh breads and pastries that she makes with the help of her children. She has been running this business for the past year. Eventhough she rents the oven where she bakes her goods she will invest the loan in the purchase of materials to improve her business, before installing her own oven. Daxnia Leticia Hildago H. is another member and she sells varied grocery items and prepared beans. Lesbia Raquel D. A. sells beauty products, perfumes and kitchenwares of the Avon name brand. They will both invest the loan in the purchase of merchandise for resale.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase materials to expand the business.

loans.name: Takku Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité TAKKU LIG. est créé le depuis 6 mois. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues du même quartier. Et appartenant au même Banc Villageois SANTHIABA COKI2.

Madame Penda G. debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, emmitouflée d’un voile rose est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est divorcée et vit avec ses trois enfants

Elle fait de l’embouche ovine, de l’aviculture, la vente de crèmes glacées et la vente de glaces.

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va acheter un mouton, des poulets à élever et payer les factures d’électricité pour la fabrique de crèmes glacées et de glaces.

Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa progéniture, par exemple la nourriture, la santé et l’habillement. Elle mène cette activité pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group TAKKU LIG. was established six months ago. It is composed of eleven women from the same district. The women belong to the same Banc Villageois of SANTHIABA COKI2. Ms. Penda G. is the group's leader (standing at the far right in the photo and snug in her pink headscarf). She is 55 years old, divorced, and living with her three children. She fattens livestock, raises poultry, and sells ice cream and ice. With her new loan, Penda is going to buy a sheep and some chickens to raise and is also going to pay the electricity bills for the making of ice cream and ice. Penda's goal is to provide for her children, for example, in terms of food, health care, and clothing. She runs her business in order to be able to support herself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a sheep and some chickens and covering the cost of electricity

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corn, wheat, and insecticide.

loans.name: Bok Xalaat Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK KHALAAT est créé le depuis 6 mois. Il est composé de 12 femmes issues du même quartier. Et appartenant au même Banc Villageois SANTHIABA COKI2.

Madame Fatou D. debout à droite de la photo de grand boubou blanc vêtue, emmitouflée avec une écharpe rouge est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans. Elle veuve et mère de 2 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge d’un enfant qui lui est confié et celle de sa grand-mère. 

Elle fait un commerce de tissus. Elle s’approvisionne en Mauritanie pour revendre dans son quartier à COKI.

Avec son crédit elle va acheter des tissus wax et Khartoum pour revendre dans son quartier. 

Son objectif est d’assurer la santé, la nourriture et le payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et de sa grand-mère.
texts.en:
The BOKK KHALAAT solidarity group was created six months ago. It consists of 12 women from the same neighborhood and members of the Banc Villageois of SANTHIABA COKI2. The head of the group is Mrs. Fatou D., standing at the far right of the photo, wearing a large white caftan and wrapped in a red scarf. She is 45 years old, a widow and mother of two dependent children. She also supports another child entrusted to her, and her grandmother. She sells fabrics. She gets her stocks in Mauritania for resale around her neighborhood in Coki. She plans to use her loan to buy wax cloth and Khartoum fabrics. Her goal is to provide her children and her grandmother with food and healthcare, and pay for the children’s tuition.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wax and Khartoum fabrics

loans.name: Bokk Jom Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité BOKK JOM est créé le depuis 6 mois. Il est composé de 09 femmes issues du même quartier. Et appartenant au même Banc Villageois SANTHIABA COKI2.

Madame Seune N. à droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 55 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants.

Elle fait un commerce de tissus depuis plus de dix ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Touba ou à Dakar pour revendre dans son quartier et les villages environnants. 

Avec son prêt elle va acheter des tissus en quantité plus importante pour augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille. Par exemple la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité des enfants
texts.en:
The solidarity group BOKK JOM came into being six months ago. It is made up of nine women who all come from the same neighborhood. They also all belong to the same "Banc Villageois" SANTHIABA COKI2. Mrs. Seune N., on the right in the photo, is the group leader. She is 55, married, and the mother of five children. She has been selling cloth for more than ten years. She buys her supplies in Touba or in Dakar and resells them in her neighborhood and the surrounding villages. With this loan she plans to buy a bigger quantity of cloth so that she can increase her profit margin. Her goal is to help her husband with the expenses of supporting their family, for example helping with food, healthcare, and school expenses for the children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth in larger quantities

loans.name: Krishna Kumari

texts.en:
This is 63 year old Krishna Kumari B.. She is married and has 2 children aged 30 and 25. In 1980, she established her agriculture business, and works 7 days a week and 8 hours a day to support her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from Patan BPW, which she used to increase the investment in her agriculture business. In the future, Krishna Kumari plans to increase her income from agriculture. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much needed cash income throughout the year.  

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates:
 BPW Partner Page     Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team

loans.use: To increase investment in agriculture.

loans.name: Manko Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité MANKO est créé le depuis 6 mois. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues du même quartier. Et appartenant au même Banc Villageois SANTHIABA COKI2.

Madame Aïssata D. à droite de la photo portant des lunettes de soleil est responsable du groupe de solidarité. Elle est âgée de 56 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle a aussi la charge de deux autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait un commerce de draps de lit, de rideaux, d’arachides et de bracelets pour enfants. 

Son prêt lui permettra d’augmenter son niveau d’approvisionnement en marchandises afin d’accroître ses bénéfices

Elle a comme objectif de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille tout en renforçant son épargne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group MANKO came into being six months ago. It is made up of 11 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They also all belong to the same "Banc Villageois" SANTHIABA COKI2. Mrs. Aïssatou D., on the right in the photo, wearing sunglasses, is the group leader. She is 56, married and the mother of one child. She is also raising two other children who were confided to her care by relatives. She sells sheets, curtains, peanuts (groundnuts) and bracelets for children. Her loan will allow her to bolster her stock so that she can make more profit. Her goal is to help her husband with the expenses of supporting their family and at the same time, put aside more savings.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Further develop and advertize her business

loans.name: Omar Torrijo Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Omar Torrijo está conformado por Luz Marina S. S., Gloria Vanesa Ríos Jiménez y Martha Adelis R. C.. Luz quien es la coordinadora se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y perfumes desde hace 2 años. Ella invertirá el dinero prestado en la compra de más insumos.

Gloria Ríos se dedica a la venta de mercadería general desde hace 2 años, en cambio Martha R. tiene un puesto de tortillas y comercializa productos AVON. Ellas también invertirán en la compra de productos para hacer crecer sus respectivos negocios.
texts.en:
The group named "Omar Torrijo" is made up of Luz Marina S. S., Gloria Vanesa R. J., and Martha Adelis R. C.. Luz is the coordinator of the group and has sold clothing, shoes and perfumes for the past 2 years. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more merchandise. Gloria R. has sold general merchandise for the past 2 years, while Martha R. sells tortillas from a stand and she also wells Avon products. She will invest the loan in the purchase of products to stock their respective businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Cheikh Makhtar Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité CHEIKH MAKHTAR a vu le jour en décembre 2009. Il est composé de 15 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles liées par des liens affectifs, de parenté et de confrérie. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DVF GUEOUL

Madame Aminata N. debout au second rang sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 2 autres enfants confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de colliers en perle, de ceinture et d’encens. Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises à Touba et à Dakar pour revendre dans son quartier lors des marchés hebdomadaires.

Ave son crédit elle va renforcer sa marchandise en perle, en ceinture et en encens.

Son objectif est de participer à la prise en charge de la famille et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels
texts.en:
The solidarity group CHEIKH MAKHTAR came into being in December 2009. It is made up of 15 women who all come from the same neighborhood. They are bound together by ties of affection or they are related to each other. The group is a part of the "Banc Villageois" of DVF GUEOUL. Mrs. Aminata N., standing in the second row in the photo, is the group leader. She is 34, married, and the mother of six children. She is also responsible for two other children who were confided to her care by relatives. She sells beaded necklaces, belts, and incense. She stocks up on merchandise in Touba and in Dakar and sells her goods in her neighborhood at weekly markets. With her loan, she is going to expand her stock of beads, belts and incense. Her goal is to help support her family and be responsible for her own personal needs.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of beaded necklaces, belts, and incense

loans.name: Sopecheikh Makhfou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPECHEIKH MAKHFOU a vu le jour en décembre 2009. Il est composé de 10 femmes issues du même quartier. Elles liées par des liens affectifs, de parenté et par voisinage. Le groupe fait partie du Banc Villageois de DVF GUEOUL

Madame Fatou N., debout au second rang sur la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle a aussi la charge de 2 autres enfants confiés par des proches. 

Elle fait du commerce. Elle se rend à Dakar acheter des articles divers pour revendre lors du marché hebdomadaire de son quartier. 

Avec son crédit elle va acheter des pochettes, des sacs à main pour dame, des chaussures etc..

Ses bénéfices lui permettent de renforcer son épargne et de perdre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sopecheikh Makhfou has been created in December 2009. It is composed of 9 women all living in the same neighborhood. They are all neighbors and relatives or friends. The group belongs to the Banc Villageois of DVF Gueoul. Mrs. Fatou N., second row (standing) in the photo, is the group’s leader. She is 34 years old. She is married and the mother of 6 children. She also has 2 other children in her care, entrusted to her by family members. She is an entrepreneur. She travels to Dakar to purchase miscellaneous items to resell them at her local weekly market. With her credit, she would like to buy plastic pouches, women’s handbags, shoes etc. Her revenues allow her to bolster her savings and to provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her business capital

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor Ramírez G. es un señora de  50 años de edad, que vive con su esposo y su hijo en una comunidad de Costa Rica llamada General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón; está comunidad se destaca por estar ubicada en el Valle del General. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería, la agricultura y comercio este último ha crecido en gran manera brindando nuevas oportunidades de trabajo.

Desde niña Flor  se levantaba todos los días a las 4.30 am de la mañana para poder ordeñar las vacas de su familia.  Por lo que la lechería ha sido parte de su vida siempre. Asegura que en su comunidad hay bastante demanda la leche que producen sus vacas. Ahora ella quiere tener su propio negocio y sabe  que con más vacas podría aumentar la producción y así sacar más provecho de sus habilidades. 

Es por eso que Doña Flor  desea obtener un micro crédito de ¢615,000 (seiscientos quince mil  colones) para comprar 3 vacas más  y poder hacer crecer  su negocio.

Doña Flor  es socia  de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su Sexto préstamo y con él espera continuar aumentando la credibilidad y sostenibilidad de su negocio
texts.en:
Flor R. G. is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and their son in a community in Costa Rica named General viejo de Perez Seledon. This community is located in the Valle del General. Her primary business is raising cattle, and selling their harvest. This business has provided them with great work opportunities. Since she was a girl, Flor woke every day at 4:30 in the morning to milk the cows. Milking cows have always been part of her life. She says that in her community the demand for milk is very great. She would like to have her own business and she knows that with more cows she would be able to increase her production, putting her time to greater use. Flor requests a loan in the amount of 615 000 colones to purchase 3 more cows, to expand her business. Flor is a member of the Community Bank named "Association of Produces El General" and it is one of 100 member organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her sixth loan and with it she will invest in sustainability plans for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 3 milking cows.

loans.name: Sope Mame Diarra Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE MAME DIARRA a été mis sur pied le jour de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois de DVF GUEOUL dont il fait partie. Il est composé de 15 femmes. Outre les liens de parenté qui les lient, les femmes partagent le même air géographique. Le petit commerce est leur activité principale.

Madame Dior D., debout à droite de la photo, est la responsable du groupe. Elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 8 enfants

Elle est vendeuse de beignets. Elle prépare les beignets de ses propres mains avant de le vendre au détail à la gare routière de son quartier. 

Avec son crédit elle va acheter de la farine de blé, de l’huile végétale, du charbon de bois et des condiments pour la préparation et cuisson de ses beignets. 

Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa famille en ce qui concerne la nourriture, la santé et la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The SOPE MAME DIARRA solidarity group was created on the inauguration day of the Banc Villageois of DVF GUEOUL, to which it belongs. It consists of 15 women. Aside from kinship, the women share the same geographic air. Their main activity is small trade. Mrs. Dior D., standing at the right of the photo, is the group leader. She is divorced and lives with her eight children. She sells beignets, which she makes by hand and then retails at the neighborhood bus station. With her loan, she plans to buy wheat flour, vegetable oil, charcoal and condiments for the preparation and cooking of beignets. Her goal is to support her family and provide her children with food, health care, and schooling.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wheat flour and condiments to make beignets

loans.name: Otto

texts.es:
Otto G. N.  es un señor de  60 años de edad, que vive con su esposa y 3 hijos  en una comunidad de Costa Rica llamada General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón; está comunidad se destaca por estar ubicada en el Valle del General. Sus principales actividades económicas son la ganadería, la agricultura y comercio este último ha crecido en gran manera brindando nuevas oportunidades de trabajo.

Don Otto se ha  dedicado  toda su vida  a la ganadería. Ahora la cría de cerdo  para engorde ha sido uno de sus principales actividades en la cual ya tiene 5 años de experiencia. El y dos socios más están construyendo la porqueriza más  grande de la comunidad.

El   desea obtener un micro crédito por un monto de ¢615 000 (seiscientos quince   mil colones) para comprar más cerdos y mejorar las condicione s de cuido e Infraestructura de su porqueriza. Con este préstamo espera alcanzar su meta de tener 150 cerdos para engorde y aprovechar el buen precio que tiene el producto en este momento.
Don Otto es socio de la Asociación de Productores El General, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su Sexto préstamo  y considera que su negocio va ser todo un éxito.
texts.en:
Otto G. N. is a 60 year old man that lives with his wife and 3 children in a community in Costa Rica called General Viejo de Pérez Zeledón. This community is noted for being located in the Valle del General. Its main economic activities are livestock breeding, agriculture and commerce, the last having grown tremendously offering new work opportunities. Don Otto has worked as a livestock breeder his whole life. Raising and fattening pigs has been one of his main activities for 5 years. He and two partners are building the largest pigsty in the community. He wants to obtain a micro loan for ¢615,000 (six hundred fifteen thousand colones - Costa Rican currency) to buy more pigs and make improvements to the infrastructure of the pigsty. With this loan he hopes to achieve his goal of having 150 pigs to fatten and take advantage of the good price that pigs are going for right now. Don Otto is a member of the Asociación de Productores El General, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his sixth loan and he thinks that his business is going to be a success.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pigs and make improvements to the pigsty

loans.name: Señor De Liwirico Rural Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Señor de Liwirco - Rural esta ubicado en el departamento de Huancavelica, inicia su quinto ciclo con 9 socios.
Haydee es Presidenta del Banco Comunal, tiene 05 hijos de 9, 18, 20, 27 y 29 años de edad, de los cuales sólo el menor asiste a la escuela. Haydee, hace 06 años que se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir, negocio que realiza desde su casa y el cual ha ido creciendo durante este tiempo gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido. 
Haydee, solicita un préstamo para poder adquirir mercadería para su negocio, ropa variada de la estación, de esta manera tendrá prendas de vestir para vender y así ir incrementando mas su negocio y tener mauores ganancias. La meta de Haydee es abrir una tienda en la ciudad de huancavelica.
texts.en:
The Señor de Liwirco – Rural Communal Bank is located in the Huancavelica department. They are beginning their fifth cycle with nine members. Haydee is the president of the communal bank. She has five children; 9, 18, 20, 27, and 29 years old. Only the youngest goes to school. Haydee has been selling clothing for six years. She sells from her house. Her business has been growing during this time thanks to the loans she has received. Haydee is requesting a loan to be able to get merchandise for her business. She will get varied seasonal clothing. That way she will have clothes to sell, she will be increasing her business, and she will have greater income. Haydee’s goal is to open a store in the city of Huancavelica.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Various seasonal clothes

loans.name: Sope Mohamed Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité SOPE MOHAMED a été mis sur pied le jour de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois de DVF GUEOUL dont il fait partie. Il est composé de 12 femmes. Outre les liens de parenté qui les lient, les femmes partagent le même air géographique. Le petit commerce est leur activité principale.

Madame Ndoumbé M. debout à l’extrême droite de la photo, de blanc vêtue est responsable du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle a aussi la charge de 3 autres enfants qui lui sont confiés par des proches.

Elle est vendeuse de poissons frais au marché du quartier. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des voitures en provenance des villages de pêcheurs.

Son crédit lui permettra d’acheter plus de paniers de poissons frais afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices.

Ses bénéfices lui offrent la possibilité de renforcer son épargne et de subvenir à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Sope Mohamed has been created the day the Banc Villageois of DVF Gueoul (to which it belongs), was launched. The group is composed of 12 women. Besides being relatives they also live in the same area. Their main business activating is retail. Mrs. Ndoumbé M., standing to the far right in the photo, dressed in white, is the group’s leader. She is married and the mother of seven dependent children. She also has three other children in her care, entrusted to her by the relatives. She sells fresh fish at the local market. She purchases her stocks from the trucks near the fishermen’s villages. Her credit will permit her to purchase a larger number of baskets with fresh fish in order to increase her income. Her revenues allow her to bolster her savings and provide for her personal needs.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fresh fish

loans.name: Relfa De Lourdes

texts.es:
Relfa de 36 años, ella vende productos de uso personal como cosméticos por catalogo de marca Yambal ( empresa que ayuda a mujeres a vender cosméticos por catalogo). 

Desde hace años ella se separo de su esposo y tuvo que conseguir dinero para poder mantener a sus hijos pequeños, cuando le hablaron de Yambal se inscribió y comenzó a vender los productos por catalogo, ahora ella trabaja en distintos horarios, vendiendo perfumes, cremas, desodorantes a sus vecinos y conocidos. 

Para continuar con las ventas de estos productos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y en el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y tener un local de los productos.
texts.en:
Relfa is 36 years old. She sells personal use products like Yambal (business that helps women sell cosmetics by catalog) brand cosmetics by catalog. Years ago she separated from her husband, and she had to get money to be able to support her young children. When they spoke to her about Yambal, she signed up and started selling their products by catalog. Now she works different schedules selling perfume, creams, and deodorants to her neighbors and acquaintances. In order to continue selling these products she wants to use the loan to buy perfumes, creams, and cosmetics. In the future she wants to finish building her house and have a place for her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothes, perfumes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Sope Naby Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SOPE NABY est né le 30 décembre 2009. Il est composé de 11 femmes issues toutes du même village. Elles se sont organisées par voisinage et par affinité. 

Madame Anta M. à l’extrême droite de la photo est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 36 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants en charge.

Elle fait un petit commerce de niébé, de beignets, de produits cosmétiques, d’encens et de parfums.

Avec son crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d’approvisionnement pour réaliser des bénéfices plus importants. 

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge financière de la famille.
texts.en:
The SOPE NABY group was created on December 30, 2009. It consists of 11 women from the same village. They came together as neighbors sharing an affinity. Mrs. Anta M., seen at the far right of the photo, is the group leader. She is 36 years old, married, and the mother of three children in he care. She has a small business selling cowpeas, cosmetics, incense and perfumes. With her loan, she plans to increase her stocks and boost her profits. Her goal is to help her husband with the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, de 37 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. Los arduos días de trabajo que tiene Félix en su chacra, le han ayudado a mejorar su economía, es por eso que trabaja todo lo que puede, sembrando plátano y café, productos que posteriormente llevará a vender al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus plantaciones, ya que sabe que unos productos sanos se venden a mejor precio, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que subir los empinados cerros de su poblado, ya que es ahí donde tiene sus sembríos. Para el futuro, espera mejorar sus chacras y sembrar en totalidad todas sus tierras. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP y esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no desea entrar en mora y perjudicar a su grupo comunal, en donde es muy querido por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los dos mil quinientos soles que solicita, comprará insumos para cuidar sus sembríos de las plagas de insectos.
texts.en:
Félix, age 37, is a very modest and hard-working man. He lives in his parents’ house, and what he wants most is to get ahead in life. Félix’s arduous days of working on his farm have helped him improve his finances. That is why he works as hard as he can planting bananas and coffee. He will later take these products to sell at the market in the city of Merced. What he likes the most about his work is taking care of his crops. He knows that healthy products sell for a better price. He has been doing this activity for five years. He considers the most difficult part to be having to climb the steep hills in his village. That is where he has his crops. In the future he hopes to improve his farm and plant on all of his land. This is his third loan with MFP, and he is prepared to make all of his payments punctually. He does not want to be in arrears and penalize his communal bank. He is held in high regard in his communal bank because of the order he imposes in their meetings. He will use the 2,500 soles that he is requesting to buy supplies to take care of his crops and protect them from plagues of insects.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to take care of his crops and protect them from plagues of insects

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter A.
